text: You leave the brig and return to your command center.

Your sensors officer and analysis team perform a thorough scan of the coordinates given to you by Nile Virens.

The location is a lightly populated, poorly developed rural zone on the far fringe of one of the more unremarkable Luddic-majority settlements. The land is nearly barren and bereft of valuable mineral deposits.

Orbital imaging shows a small, struggling farmstead close to the coordinates given. An individual human appears to be present, though it would require observation over a greater time period to fully establish an accurate count of inhabitants. There are also what appear to be a collection of burial sites near the farmstead.

"At least," your sensors officer reports, "that's what it appears to be. Weapons, people; many things can be hidden. Especially with the interference caused by this magnetic field..."
You order a shuttle prepared for descent to the coordinates provided to you by Nile Virens.
options:
lke_bornanewShuttle1:Take the shuttle to the surface
lke_bornanewVisitScan:Order a scan of Bornanew's coordinates
lke_prepMarines:Bring a squad of marines as backup
lke_bornanewAbort:Scrub the launch and consider your options

script:
SetTooltip lke_prepMarines "Requires at least 6 marines."
SetTooltipHighlights lke_prepMarines 6
SetEnabled lke_prepMarines false

text:
You order a half-dozen of your most experienced marines to don surface warfare stealth-op gear.

Their outer suits shimmer and rustle, and six sleek black marines in light armor transform before you into a dusty haze, like a fiery, killing wind of divine vengeance out of some ancient Luddic myth.

You have to but whisper the code-phrase and they will perform a rapid assault to secure your position from most forms of military equipment available on Mazalot.

The spectra of charged particles interacting with Mazalot's atmosphere flare and break like ocean waves.

Your shuttle's descent is smooth, your pilot interfacing with the lackadaisical local traffic control and receiving only token objection to landing near a Luddic-majority settlement.

"Near" is a relative term, of course; you're well over the horizon from all but a half-dozen of the prefab hab units that have been dragged out here and modified by their inhabitants. Half of those appear to be abandoned, the surrounding fields rippled with dust.
Your shuttle lands, kicking up a cloud that wafts outward in a diminishing wave over a desolation of erratic boulders and ashy-looking trees.
Your shuttle lands, and in a blur your marine squad fans out into the surrounding plain, a desolation of erratic boulders and ashy-looking trees.

Before you is a modified prefab hab. A corroded, leaking irrigation system shudders unsteadily as it tends to an unhealthy-looking garden grid. The adjacent crop field is quite dead.

On the flight in, the shuttle sensors tagged a living human figure in the sheltered grove nearby.

You follow a path toward the grove. Protected from the parching winds by a low rise, it seems that the trees planted here collect almost enough moisture to survive.

A new run of ceramolith pipe follows the trail to the grove. Like someone wanted to water the trees.

You follow a path toward the grove. Sheltered from the dry winds by a low rise, it seems that the trees planted here collect almost enough moisture to survive. But not quite.

Your marines whisper tactical call-and-response in your ear. "$PlayerSirOrMadam," the squad leader addresses you personally, "Target ID confirmed; visual match with Bornanew. Appears unarmed."

script:
Call $global.lke_ref playMusicJethro
AddStoryPoints 1
BeginConversation bornanew
$player.metBornanew = true
FireAll LKEjethroOptions
text:
The shade of the grove is speckled by light filtering through thin leaves.

You find a large man in a long, dusty hooded coat, almost a robe. His back is to you.

There are a handful of Luddic grave-markers here; brightly painted with natural pigments. These look well maintained. 

The man's head is bowed, his hands clasped in prayer.

options: lke_jethroC:"I'm taking you back to Gilead."
lke_jethroWhat:"What happened with infiltrating the Path? You had a mission."
lke_jethroWhy:"Why does Jaspis want you back so badly?
lke_jethroDead:"If you like, I can have found you dead here."
lke_jethroAngels:"Wait- what was that about the 'song of angels'?"

text:
"Oh, um." He looks at you to see if you're really asking this, now. You are.

"There are... writings around Ludd. From the early disciplines, recorded later. They tend to be heavily, ah, corrected in accordance with the Church's rulings in accordance with Ludd's wishes. Or what is known of them. Others, unofficial copies, have been created by con-artists and heretics to prove their own schemes and cults. These, the Knights purge. Some are kept as examples. For teaching; heretic-finding."

He shakes his head, "Anyway. The song of angels."
"To put it crudely, in some accounts it is said that God spoke to the Prophet Ludd through... through singing only Ludd could hear."

options: lke_jethroAngelsTalkA2:"It sounds like a neurological issue."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkB:"There was a time I heard... distant music. Like a choir."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkB:"I have heard... distant music. Like a choir. Wasn't in telemetry."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkC:"It's been said that Brother Livewell Cotton hears music. 'A choir of angels', those were the words."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkD:"Brother Livewell Cotton told me he has heard music. A 'choir of angels', he said."

text: "To be so blessed must be a burden beyond all knowing," Bornanew says grimly.

"It could," Bornanew says, and looks to you. "Where between madness and the divine stands a prophet?"

"-On uneasy ground," he finishes; quoting something with a hint of a smile.
"It is not the time for theology," Bornanew says agreeably.
He raises an eyebrow at you.

options: lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellZig:"I heard the music when we encountered a strange ship. It used exotic technologies unknown to even the Domain."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates:"I heard the music when we scanned the Gates, the Domain Gates, using a new method."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellZigOrbit:"That ship, the Ziggurat, is in orbit. In my fleet."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOmen:"What am I supposed to do with a 'fearful omen'?"
lke_jethroAngelsPOLa:"Walk the Path of Light? That doesn't help."
lke_jethroAngelsPOLb:"I will try to walk the path of light. When the time comes."
lke_jethroAngelsPOLc:"'Path of light'? Brother Cotton told me the same thing."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOut:"Let us speak of other things."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkOut:"Never mind. It's not important now."

text: "I apologize," he says. "After you came all this way, I have only the words of a novice to offer you. No great secrets or wisdom."
"I pray for your strength," he says.
"Truly?" Bornanew shakes his head, "Now it is I who is tested by a fearful omen."
"That sounds like a fearful omen," Bornanew says earnestly.
Almost unconsciously he looks up to the sky, and says "Ludd's grace preserve us."

He lets out a sigh.

"Reason as well as life are gifts of the Creator. We are tested by confrontation with divine mystery. We must decide if we follow the highest path, or merely the most convenient."

He speaks more quietly, "It is a test. When the time comes, will you walk the path of light?"

"The doctrine of the Church tells us the Gates are a product of technological sin. I'm sure you know this," Bornanew says, watching you carefully. "Ludd's words, as far as we know them, do not put it quite so simply."

options:
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2A2:"I have traversed the Gates. A lesser crossing, but I have the technology."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2a:"The Gates are a gift, Bornanew. We should use them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2b:"The Gates are dangerous. They must be studied carefully."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2d:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2c:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them." (lie)

text: "Then I beg Providence save us," Bornanew almost whispers. "I know not what door you have opened."

options:
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2a:"The Gates are a gift, Bornanew. We should use them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2b:"The Gates are dangerous. They must be studied carefully."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2d:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them."
lke_jethroAngelsTalkTellGates2c:"Just as well, because I intend to avoid them." (lie)

text: "I admit, captain, that I cannot but look upon this gift with suspicion when the bones of the Domain lie moldering around us."
"One must be careful around great and terrible works such as the Gates. Even your science suggests that observation may change both subject and observer."
"Just as well, then. But I suspect few of the great factions share your intent."
"Just as well, then," Bornanew says, as if you've both just agreed to not discuss something. "I suspect the great factions will do little to avoid them."
"Of course. It is not now the time for theology," Bornanew says, watching you carefully.
"He would not be the first to make that claim," Bornanew says. "Nor the last, I am sure. God save us if Cotton were a prophet."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "Yes. I am Jethro Bornanew."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "No," he says. He glances back at the graves. "This farm - what's left of it - they built it. So I was told."

"No," he says, looking at the graves. "I never met them. Not when they were alive, I mean."

"This farm - what's left of it - they built it. So I was told."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you, a hint of concern on his face. "I see. The Reverend Archcurate. Of course."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you. "Of course."
He unclasps his hands and turns to you, a hint of concern on his face. "I see. Jaspis, of course."
He looks over your uniform, then past you toward the ridgeline. "You came a long way. Captain, I assume?"

He looks over your uniform, then past you toward the ridgeline.

"You came a long way. And you brought warriors." He turns back to the graves, "I've counted two, so far."

"It is." He looks down at the graves. "It was."

"I've discovered that I'm a poor farmer, captain. It seems like everything withers at my touch."
He gives you a strange look. "If you really want to, I suppose."
options:
lke_jethroJeffA:"Jeff it is. More efficient."
lke_jethroJeffB:"Jeff it is. It's less... you know."
lke_jethroJeffC:"I'm not being serious. Your name is Jethro."

text: "Less Luddic, you mean," he says with a smirk. "I understand."
"Less Luddic," he says with a smirk. "I understand."

"Ah," he smiles awkwardly. 

"I apologize. This is all... not a shock, exactly. A rather big turn on the path that I have found to be my life, I suppose. It is a lot to reflect upon, now that it is happening."

"I failed," he says.

After a moment, he speaks again, "And I confess, I wanted to fail. After meeting the recruiter on Chalcedon..." Bornanew shakes his head.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedge:"Sedge?"
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"Sedge? Don't worry, I killed him."

text:
"I failed," he says.

After a moment, he speaks again, "And I confess, I wanted to fail. After meeting the recruiter on Chalcedon..." Bornanew shakes his head.

"Yes," he looks surprised, "That was his name. I did not like the man. I did not like the things I would have to do to make him like me."

Bornanew looks away, "He seemed to be someone I might have been if I had lived a different life. Walked a different path."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"Don't worry, I killed Sedge."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"The deed is done. Or not done, in your case. Let it go."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"But you're not him. That's why Jaspis wants you back."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"You'll have to learn to be a lot less squeamish if you're to be a Knight."

text:
"You- what?" He looks you in the eyes, to confirm that you are telling the truth. He quickly discovers that you are.

"I have no words," he says, shaking his head.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledA:"Aren't you a Knight Initiate? How can you be so squeamish?"
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledB:"Don't worry about it."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilledC:"You could try 'thank you'."

text:
"I might not be when I get back," he admits.

"But you're right. It is probable that a Knight will be called upon to kill to defend the Faith. It is what I agreed to, what I swore I would learn."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"Look, this one was on me. Don't worry about it."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text:
"I feel that I must," he says. "In one sense, his death is due to my choices, though I had no way of knowing it."

"It is true also that he was, by all accounts - and indeed in my judgment - an evil man. His faith twisted in upon itself. It shielded him from remorse for his... actions."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"You're worrying about it. I told you not to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text:
"I cannot do that," he says.

"I do concede that he was, by all accounts and indeed my judgment, an evil man. His faith, it was twisted in upon itself. It shielded him from remorse for his... actions."
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"... You're welcome."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text: "I cannot do that," he says.
options:
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2A:"... You're welcome."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2B:"See? This is why you're the man for whatever Jaspis is up to."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled2C:"It gets easier with practice."

text: He nods hesitantly, and says "Then I will speak no further on this matter."
He gives you a skeptical look, "That worries me all the more."
"Your words are a cold comfort, captain."

"The Reverend Archcurate," he says automatically.

"Sorry," he adds quickly. "Habit. They really drill it into you in the Church. Archcurate Jaspis... told me I could call her Sophronia, as if I was family."

"She wants to change the path of the Faith, I believe. She believes I can help her do it."

options: lke_jethroWhyOptB:"People died for me to find you."
lke_jethroWhatSedgeKilled:"I shot a man to find you."
lke_jethroWhyOptD:"No one else seems to think much of you."

text:
"So was Ludd," he says, and laughs. 

"Ah," he catches himself, and wipes his eyes. "Forgive me my blasphemy. I do not believe I am Ludd; I do not hear God's word in the songs of angels."
He sighs deeply. "Was it necessary?"
options:
lke_jethroWhyOptBnotImp:"That's not important now. I have a mission to complete."
lke_jethroWhyOptByes:"Yes. In conflicts between the powerful, that's how it works."
lke_jethroWhyOptBno:"No. I may have overreacted."

text: "Gilead," he says, staring at the graves.
He looks at you uneasily, but says nothing.
"I see," he looks at you uneasily.

He shrugs. "The Reverend Archcurate does. And that was enough to bring you here, for me."

He glances over at you, "I don't care to speculate about how many credits she's wasting on me."

"Yes," he says and glances at you. Expecting some news of Jaspis' health, maybe. He turns away again.

"Time comes for us all. I expect she sees that. She wants to leave behind a world... that's better, I think."
options:
lke_jethroWhyOptEa:"An admirable cause."
lke_jethroWhyOptEb:"A hopeless dream."
lke_jethroWhyOptEc:Say nothing.

text: He grunts acknowledgement, looking down at the brightly painted graves.
He doesn't respond. Just looks down at the brightly painted graves.

He quickly turns to stare at you with a strange intensity. "I-," he begins, and his words catch in his throat. He breathes heavily for a moment, almost unsteady on his feet.

"No," he says. "I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
options:
lke_jethroDeadHopelessA:"Feeling okay?"
lke_jethroDeadHopelessB:Give him a moment
lke_jethroDeadHopelessC:"Don't die for real on me, now."

text: "No," he says, then "Yes, I mean. I'm fine. Just, the answer is no. I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
"No," he says. "The answer is no. I'm coming with you to Gilead. It's what I have to do."
He quickly turns to stare at you with a strange intensity. "I-," he begins, and his words catch in his throat. He breathes heavily for a moment, almost unsteady on his feet.
options:
lke_jethroDead1a:"Feeling okay?"
lke_jethroDead1b:Give him a moment
lke_jethroDead1c:"Don't die for real on me, now."

text:
After a moment, he lets a breath out, and then almost - but not quite - casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Yes. Yes, I am well. Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

He lets a breath out, and then almost casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Forgive me," he clears his throat. "Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

After a moment, he lets a breath out, and then almost - but not quite - casually wipes a sleeve across his face. His eyes are red, you see.

"Yes. Yes, I am well. Is your offer serious? You would do this thing for me?"

options:
lke_jethroDeadOut1:"Yes. Just say the word."
lke_jethroDead3a:"Of course. I just need a body to substitute." (look pointedly at the graves)
lke_jethroDead3b:"I afraid I cannot. The Archcurate gave me a mission and I intend to complete it."

text:
"No," he says with a sudden ferocity.

He catches himself, then begins again, more calmly, 
"And no, forget about all of that. I'm coming with you to Gilead. I have to."
"Of course," he says quietly. "I have a duty; I made a promise."

He looks, struck silent, at the light coming through the trees.

"Let someone else walk my path."

He turns to you. "I accept. Tell Jaspis... tell her... I should write something, maybe..."
options:
lke_jethroDeadOut2b:"No. You must live for yourself now."
lke_jethroDeadOut2a:"You should. It will help. She was... emotional."

text:
He sighs, covering his face with his hands. "I can't do this. I'm sorry."

"I have a duty. I made a promise. It's what I have to do."

"But..." he falls silent.

In a long minute, he appears to accept your words.
"This is it then," he turns and looks at you once more.
options:
lke_jethroDeadOut3a:"It is. Burn bright, burn long." (leave)
lke_jethroDeadOut3b:"It is. Blessed be your path." (leave)
lke_jethroDeadOut3c:"It is. Keep your head down." (leave)

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.jethroName = Jethro
$global.lke_foundBornanew2 = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
You walk from the graves, from the dry grove, and return to your shuttle, and it returns you to your $shipOrFleet.

Jethro Bornanew - the man who was once called Jethro Bornanew - is a free man now. Free of his oath, free of schemes; free to live his next life, whatever it may be.

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.jethroName = Jethro
$global.lke_foundBornanew2 = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
text:
You walk from the graves, from the dry grove. Your marine squad falls in like spirits of the desert summoned to material form.

Jethro Bornanew - the man who was once called Jethro Bornanew - is a free man now. Free of his oath, free of schemes; free to live his next life, whatever it may be.

Finding a body to substitute for Bornanew is not difficult. One that appears to have died a violent death, but at least a quick death?

Shot in the back by a Pather seems likely, but too dramatic. An accident, then; even easier. A thruster malfunction at the docks. Over in a split second, and no one really to blame except slipshod safety/control measures. One of those unhappy little events that Providence provides to bring an unexpected end to the path of life... and which burns away obvious identifying features.

The Reverend Archcurate will accept a closed-casket burial, you think.

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
FireAll LKEjeffCheck
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.lke_foundBornanew = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
You and Bornanew walk from the graves, from the dry grove.

"There's nothing here I need," Bornanew says as you pause before the dying farmstead. "I am prepared to leave."

The shuttle returns you to your $shipOrFleet.

script:
Call $global.lke_ref resumeMusic
FireAll LKEjeffCheck
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowLargePlanet
$global.lke_foundBornanew = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
You walk with Bornanew from the graves, from the grove. The marine squad falls in like spirits of the desert summoned to material form.

"There's nothing here I need," Bornanew says as you pause before the dying farmstead. "I am prepared to leave."

The shuttle returns to your $shipOrFleet.

id: # LKE return to Gilead with Bornanew; he's "dead"

text: "And." Her tone is flinty; she is not unperceptive.
options:
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis3:"I have his body for you." (lie)
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis5:"I told him I would tell you he is dead."

text:
"I understand," she says. A wall of ice, betrayed only by a glint in her eyes.

"Have him sent down. I shall compel the Knights to make the correct arrangements."

She pauses, taking a deep breath.

script:
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
AddCredits 50000
ShowDefaultVisual
FireAll LKEdoFinish
text:
"Captain. You have provided me... closure. You shall receive your compensation. May Providence guide us, may God forgive us."

She closes the link somewhat abruptly, sending you to a CGR standby mode which is quickly picked up by an aide who arranges the credits transfer, and a flight path for the shuttle to deliver the body.

After a long, long moment she speaks.

"I understand," she says, a wall of ice.

"Was the notion his, or yours?"
She nods, slowly, with the weight of her years.
She nods, slowly, with the weight of her years.
"Perhaps it does not," she says in bitter agreement.
"You have failed to fulfill the terms of our agreement."
options:
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis6a:"I gave you the truth. Is that not enough?"
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis6b:"I accept that failure because I have freed a man."
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis6c:"Do you want me to go kidnap him?"
lke_returnToGileadDeadJaspis6d:"Would it make you happy if I shot Bornanew and brought back his body?"

text:
"It is not," she says sharply. "But it is all I have, so upon it I shall subsist."

A long pause, and then, "You shall receive your credits."

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson HOSTILE -5
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
AddCredits 50000
ShowDefaultVisual
$global.lke_fakeBornanewDeathButTold = true
FireAll LKEdoFinish
text: She closes the link abruptly, sending you to a CGR standby mode. An instant later, a secretary activates the comms to arrange for the credits transfer in a terse transaction.

"What a joyous world is yours," Jaspis says, "where all may be free as they like with little concern of the evil permitted reign by their dereliction of God-given necessity."

A pause, then, "You shall receive your credits."

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson HOSTILE -15
$player.ethosFreedom++
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
AddCredits 50000
ShowDefaultVisual
$global.lke_fakeBornanewDeathButTold = true
FireAll LKEdoFinish
text: She closes the link abruptly, sending you to a CGR standby mode. An instant later, a secretary activates the comms to arrange for the credits transfer in a terse transaction.

"No. Leave him. Free will was given to us by God that we would use it, and err."

A pause, then, "You shall receive the credits."

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson HOSTILE -10
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
AddCredits 50000
ShowDefaultVisual
$global.lke_fakeBornanewDeathButTold = true
FireAll LKEdoFinish
text: She closes the link abruptly, sending you to a CGR standby mode. An instant later, a secretary activates the comms to arrange for the credits transfer in a terse transaction.

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson HOSTILE -30
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
$global.lke_fakeBornanewDeathButToldWasJerk = true
FireAll LKEdoFinish
text:
She gives you a surprisingly fierce look through old, blind eyes.

"No. Leave the matter closed. We shall not speak again."

She closes the link.

script:
$global.lke_completed = true
Call $global.lke_ref doCleanup
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions

id: # LKE return to Gilead with Bornanew

options: lke_returnToGileadJaspis2:"I found Bornanew. He's here, with my $shipOrFleet."

text:
"Heavens rejoice!" A ray of unselfconscious joy breaks through the Archcurate's well-tended walls.

"You must bring him here, I must see him," she pauses, then laughs at herself. "You know what I mean. Come now, I shall have the Knights forgo their accustomed rigidity."

She cuts her end of the comm-link with unusual speed, leaving you with a static holding image provided by the Church: a human silhouette descending to Gilead on a beam of light.

An implausible image at best.

id: # Now, actually take him to Jaspis

options: 3:lke_shuttleDownBornanew:Take a shuttle with Bornanew to the surface

text:
Your shuttle is given an unusually expedient flight path to the complex housing Jaspis' office.

Bornanew watches the green world of Gilead grow below you.
options:
lke_endingJaspisStart:Let him watch
lke_endingStartA:"It's no Mazalot, is it."
lke_endingStartB:"How are you doing, $global.jethroName?"

text:
He smiles, acknowledging the absurdity of your statement.

"Mazalot wasn't all bad. There was a sort of freedom there that can't be found on Gilead, though much danger as well."

He turns back to the view, "I did miss the green."

He smiles politely. "Apprehensive, I confess. I believe I shall be punished by the Knights, though the Reverend Archurate may try to shield me. I shall ask her not to. An oath is an oath."

"I suspect there will be much silent contemplation and scrubbing of floors." He looks thoughtful, "They do like that sort of thing. I don't mind it." He turns back to the face of Gilead.

You are met on the landing pad by a solemn Luddic Knight and attending Knight Initiate. The Knight's frown deepens noticeably as they take in Bornanew. 

Knight Ailanthus leads you to Archcurate Jaspis' office in otherwise judgmental silence. Bornanew takes this treatment in stride, enjoying the gardens and fresh air.

script:
BeginConversation jaspis
ShowSecondPerson bornanew
AdjustRepPerson jaspis FRIENDLY 15
text:
As you enter Jaspis' office, Knight Ailanthus inhales to announce you - and the Archcurate interrupts. 

"Jethro, here you are!" she says, "Providence provides!" Knight Ailanthus lets out a cough, and Jaspis responds by waving them away.

"As well, I must attest, by way of the efforts of the good captain whose footsteps I hear also," she says, smiling, "For lest we forget, the Path of the righteous will not walk upon itself, is that not so?"

Bornanew takes Jaspis' small, frail hand in his own. "Yes, of course. Please, Mother Sophronia, you must not get too excited. It is just me, and I have caused you much distress."

"Yes and truly, " she says, shaking Bornanew off. "And for it you've already decided to undergo some senseless display of penance, I doubt not. An unseemly habit learnt from the Knights."

"Captain," she turns toward you. "You must grow tired of this, so I shall be succinct: you have my deepest gratitude. My secretary shall see that you receive your payment."

She aims herself at the doorway, "Degory, attend!"

As you leave with Degory, you hear Jaspis address Bornanew.

"The balance of power is changed; both I and the Faith's future have need of you. But..."

"Why 'Jeff'?" she asks.

You don't hear his reply.

script:
AdjustRepPerson bornanew FRIENDLY 4
$option = lke_endingWrapup2 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
Bornanew puts his hands together and nods his head.

Blind to his response, Jaspis begins to address him, "The balance of power is changed; both I and the Faith's future have need of you..."

script:
HideSecondPerson
EndConversation
ShowDefaultVisual
AddCredits 50000
unset $global.lke_foundBornanew
Call $lke_ref doCleanup
$global.lke_completed = true
Call $global.lke_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
The soft-spoken secretary, Degory, produces an incongruous datapad from her robes and conducts the transfer of the Archcurate's payment to your accounts. She then passes you off to the grim-faced Knight Ailanthus to escort you to your waiting shuttle. 

Your return to orbit is uneventful.

id: # LKE generic Jaspis talk during mission

text:
You speak first with some kind of secretary who politely persuades you to wait patiently.

After a short time, the image of the Archcurate Jaspis appears. She makes little effort to look toward comms feed as she putters around her office.

"It is good to hear from you, captain," she says. "Have you found Novice Bornanew?"
options:
lke_jaspisTalkNotYet:"Not yet."
cutCommLinkPolite:Cut the comm link

text: "Then I shall pray that Providence sees fit to give you a path both short and safe."

看来当你接近通讯中继站时，它将自动使用安全通道传输扫描结果，然后从你的设备中自我删除。
你已经全面勘探过该行星了。

id: # default commission conversation strings, copy and adjust this section for faction-specific conversation flavor

text: "这是在开玩笑吗？如果你真的是那个人，那么你已被列在好几份 $faction 的通缉名单上了！"
"你已经在 $theOtherCommissionFaction 任职了。你必须先辞职了才能加入 $theFaction。"
"很抱歉，你不符合我们的军队就职标准。"

"嗯，好的。你的确是个合适的人选。。

但接受军官任命协议是个非常重大的决定。这意味着你有义务与 $theFaction 的敌人作战，无论对方身处何方。

你也可随时辞去你的军务，但这样做绝不会让你赢得任何朋友。"
"那么，怎么样？还想签约吗？"
"太好了，欢迎加入！"
"我还能为您做些什么？"

"好吧，并不是所有人都为维护 $theFaction 的理想付出如此之多，这并不丢人。

那么，我还能为你做些什么？"
"你确定吗？$theFaction 信赖可靠的人，你的这种背弃不会轻易被原谅。"
"看来你是拿定主意了。行，至少你还是有礼貌地亲自递交了你的辞呈。"
"明智的决定。你这种人值得为我们继续效力。"
"这是在开玩笑吗？假使你的身份真的如你所言，那么来自至圣长老们的多份圣令已经定罪于你了。"
"You're already commissioned by $theOtherCommissionFaction. The heart holds but one faith; until you resign that commission, it would be quite unthinkable to be commissioned by the Church."
"很抱歉，你还无法承担教会的委任。"

"Hmm, yes, you have proven your faith through good works.

Accepting a commission is a serious matter. You will be required to fight enemies of the Church wherever they may be found; to uphold the Eleven Virtues; to condemn and abhor vice.

Your commission may be resigned at any time, though it would be a very poor sign of faith in the Church. And in terms of worldly matters, it would be considered a black mark indeed by Ludd's faithful."
"你愿意接受卢德的祝福，承担行使正义的责任吗？"
"赞美群星之灵！让我能有幸能成为首个欢迎你跻身于正义修业的人。"
"我不会耽搁你的圣务。但凡你需要我提供协助，还请直言，不要有所顾虑。"

"诚然，这并不是每个人必经的修业之道，毕竟它被暴力、诱惑和困苦所充斥。圣神卢德会为我们每一个卑微的灵魂都赋予他神圣的爱，不要为你追寻它的道路较为谦卑而感到羞耻。

让我们暂时抛开荣光与悔恨，看看现在我还能在其他方面帮上你什么吗？"

"Are you sure, child of Earth? The Church of Galactic Redemption is the worldly expression of Ludd's holy teachings, the only path to salvation not only of your own soul, but the means by which all humanity may raise itself from the scourge of collective sin.

I cannot sit in judgment of your soul; the spiritual consequence of your choice is between you and the Divine. But the faithful are but women and men of these fallen worlds, and they may see in you one who has turned their back on the path of the Blessed Ludd. You would be scorned by the Faithful."
"I can see there's no changing your mind. Be wary of the path you tread, but remember that Ludd loved even those who were betrayers in that final day."
"明智的抉择。在履行圣务时，我们的灵魂时常会受到考验，我们的信念不时会发生动摇。但请谨记，正义之道永远被卢德的光辉所照耀，无论它在艰难苦困之中显得多么暗淡。"
"你这是在开玩笑吗，公民？如果你是你所声称的人，那么你已经被列入好几个顶级部委的通缉名单了。说实话，我现在不得不向霸主 COMSEC 上报这整个对话。"

"You're already commissioned by $theOtherCommissionFaction. I don't know if loyalty means anything to you, citizen, but it is a core pillar of our values. You would have to resign that commission before you'd even be considered for commission as an Auxiliary by the Hegemony."
"你不符合就任军职的标准，公民。"

"嗯，舰队情报部似乎已经观察你有一段时间了，这里说你通过了审查。

接受 霸主 的委任是一件很严肃的事情，公民。你将被要求与 霸主 的敌人作战，并在官方机构管辖范围之外的地区里协助维护法律和秩序。最重要的是，你将致力于在全人类的宇宙空间中为复兴人之领而战。

我不得不告知你，你有权在任何时候辞去你的职务。虽然以前也曾有过体面辞职的情况，但算是我私下和你讲，辞职会被舰队情报部认为是非常可疑的行为，更别提那些忠诚的 霸主 军官们会怎么想了。"
"By the power invested in me by the office of the High Hegemon, I offer you commission as Auxiliary to the Hegemony Navy. Do you wish to sign on?"
"很好，欢迎入伍！"
"那么，我还能为你做些什么，公民？"

"的确，不是每个人都能有坚强的人格，把挺身维护 霸主 利益的行为提升到如此高的标准。毕竟，这个星域也需要商人和穿梭机驾驶员。在他们自己的小圈子里，那也是很光荣的职业。

还有什么我可以为你做的吗？"
"你确认吗，公民？确认就意味着你同意将辞职经历作为你档案的一部分被记录下来。霸主需要可靠的人，如果你失信于我们，那不会轻易被原谅。"
"我明白了，至少你还有足够的勇气来亲自递交辞呈。"

"A good decision. Despite what dissident agitprop may claim, the Hegemony does not ask blind obedience. It takes courage to first question then choose to reaffirm a commitment. We can use people like you in this troubled age."
"我很惊讶，您居然还敢发起通讯。因为您造成的损害，光是一份您准确无误的全息照片，都有不少高层主管私下出钱要收。这样看来，不是所有的仇恨都是能够用钱买通的。现在我给您提个免费的建议：立即从这一带紧急加速出去。"
"您已经与 $theOtherCommissionFaction 签订协议任职了。依照速子标准的竞业禁止协议，在与速子科技签约之前，还需请您辞去该职务。请在您处理好手边的未尽事务之后再来访。"
"我们的人力资源部门报告说，您当前恐怕还不符合我们对委任协议承担者的预期标准。"

"嗯，是的，您的简历令人印象深刻。我们人力资源部已经关注您有好一段时间了。

现在还请您明白，与速子科技公司 (以及相关的附属公司) 签署这份委托合同是一件非常严肃的承诺。您将要承担与公司指定的交战者作战的风险，无论是敌方是海盗、反市场主义鼓吹者，还是实行非法搜查并扣押公司财产的各种国家级实体。

您可以在任何时候辞去您的委托职务，且不会受到经济方面的处罚。在我看来，这的已经是很宽厚的条款了。但如果您这样做，那就意味着您将...怎么说呢，被扔到鲨鱼堆里了？我的朋友，由于公司的内部竞争异常激烈，一旦您主动放弃了公司给予的法律保护，那么我们就不会对之后发生的任何事情负责。"
"那还想签约吗？签的话就在刚出现在您 TriPad 上的通知上按一下指纹就可以了。"

"太好了！我很荣幸能成为第一个祝贺您加入公司的人。

还有，啊，您介意我在 TriLink 上添加您为好友吗？我一直在寻求和像您这些有潜力的新人多交流联系。"
"我现在还能为您做些什么吗，我们重要的团队成员？"

"啊，您这是在货比三家，看谁开出条件最好。说中了吧？真明智。哦还有，刚才我们所讨论的细节自然都受标准的速子公司保密协议所保护。

那今天还有什么我可以为您效劳的吗？"
"您确定吗？您将会错过推动您事业发展的绝佳机会，而且公司也更看重那些懂得自我激励的人。还有我提醒您，公司里有些人可能会因此觉得您...很好欺负。"

"看来我是没法挽留您了。有人给了您开出了更好的价码，对吧？不，不用说了，我都懂。

如果他们给的薪水真的那么高，到时候要是还有空缺，就别忘了我。还有，我建议您暂时先避开 速子科技 的星区一段时间。"
"明智的选择。速子科技 尊重每一位重要的公司成员想通过谈判来巩固其职位或 —— 恕我冒昧 —— 谋求升职的意愿。"
"这是在开玩笑吧？能让 联盟 各星球一致同意的事情不多，但你作为全星域的威胁就是其中之一。我绝对会提醒联合舰队情报部注意这次联络的。"
"看来你已经在 $theOtherCommissionFaction 签约就职了。联盟是建立在尊重其各成员 —— 或潜在成员 —— 独立性的基础之上的，因此目前让你服役会违反协议。在与联盟签约之前，你必须辞去该职务。"
"我很抱歉，但这边说你不符合我们的选拔标准。我们只任命那些在维护联盟利益和价值观方面有良好记录的人。"

"嗯，是的，你的声望良好，联盟 世界数据库中没有人对你进行一票否决。

接受 英仙座联盟 的雇佣协议是一件严肃的事情。这意味着你必须学习并遵守 [联盟宪章] 的八项规定。你将有义务与试图将霸权主义强加于整个英仙座星域的敌人进行斗争。你将以各种方式投身于建设人类崭新的未来，让全人类免于遭受任何集权政体的统治，并促进彼此间携手互助，互利共赢。这是崇高的理想，我的朋友，也是值得付之于终身奋斗的理想。

依照正式流程，我必须告知你，你有权在任何时候辞去你的职务。辞职后，联盟 将没有任何法律手段来保护你免受...怎么说呢...免受那些可能感到被蔑视的成员私下对你施加影响。你要知道这些。"
"那么，考虑好了吗？关于八项要求的测试实际上只是走个形式。还有虽然联盟成员可以在你签约后的一年内向委员会提交任命否决提案，但这很少发生。你确定接受签约吗？"
"太好了，我谨代表星域内的自由星球，欢迎你加入英仙座联盟。"
"我还能为你做些什么？"

"好的，我能理解。这份工作不但充满危险，还需要有非凡的品格来坚定贯彻联盟的理想。拒绝这份承诺并不可耻，毕竟我们坚持奋战的目标就是你在此时此刻能自由地做出选择。

那么，我还能为你做些什么？"
"你确定么？联盟 需要你这样可靠的人来维护我们的准则。尽管你现在可以行使你的权力，选择离开。但 联盟 里那些不这么宽宏大量的成员可能对这种可以被视为背叛忠诚的行为有所猜疑，甚至进行报复。"

"看来你已经下定决心了。我谨代表 联盟 感谢你至今所做出的贡献，以及你亲自提交辞呈时的礼貌。

现在，如果你不介意的话，我需要填写一些表格来落实这个程序。"
"很高兴你改变主意了，联盟 需要像你这样的人继续效力。"
"这是在开玩笑吗？如果你是你说的那个恐怖分子，这里正好就有一份由狮心统帅亲自签署的处决令要交给你。现在我必须立即向我的上级汇报这次通讯。"

"The Sindrian Diktat honors loyalty, and you've come here like a guileless mercenary bearing another faction's flag. You would have to resign your commission with $theOtherCommissionFaction before you could even be considered to be commissioned into our movement."
"You are not fit to perform service for the Diktat. We only accept candidates that prove their strength and above all their passion for the admiral's great movement."

"Hmm, we've had our eye on you for some time it seems. This intelligence summary makes it clear that you're a suitable candidate for commission into the Sindrian Diktat's volunteer force.

Accepting a commission into our glorious movement is a serious matter. You must pledge unwavering loyalty to our leader, Supreme Executor Admiral Andrada, and the Sindrian Diktat he commands. You will fight our enemies, cleanse the Sector of the corrupt old order, and usher in a new age for our people. If you are lucky, you may even attain the glory of giving your life for the great cause.

Now it is technically possible to resign the Diktat commission, but this would reveal a deep betrayal of sacred loyalty. I pledged my blood to the Lion, and I would expect the same from you.
"下定决定了吗？向你所忠诚的 辛达强权 发誓！"
"Glory to the Lion of Sindria! You will be forged in conflict for a new age!"

"接受委托之后你就自动成为了强权党员。相关的意识形态全息读本链接已经推送给了你的 TriPad。

那么还有什么事吗，同志？"

"的确，并不是所有的人都足够坚强，能为维护 辛达 利益而挺身而出。要知道，我们都是战士，为人类重归荣耀时代而战。最终决战将铸造强者，而其他渣滓则会被彻底清除，成为历史长河中微不足道的尘埃。

如果你适合服役，那你就必须选择在最终决战里站在哪一边。认真考虑一下吧。"
"我希望你知道这不是什么能开玩笑的事情。你应该很清楚，忠诚是 辛达强权 的最高思想。辛达瑞亚之狮不会容忍那些对我们的伟大运动缺乏坚定信念的人。"

"我算是看清你了，你没有能担当我们伟大事业的骨气。

滚出我的通讯频道！叛徒！我会立刻向党内情报部汇报的。"

"我会从宽处理，不会把这...对形势的严重误判上报上去。我冒这个险，是因为我依然相信你可以成为我们伟大事业的一部分。

谨慎前行，同志。"

options: 10:aiCores_startTurnIn:"我想上缴我找到的这些 AI 核心..."

script:
SetTooltip aiCores_startTurnIn "你没有 AI 核心。"
SetEnabled aiCores_startTurnIn false

text: "A fascinating offer. Why, if one of the major factions caught you with these, they might just seize them outright. Tell you what - I'll do you a favor and give you a good price."
"你把这些东西带给我是个明智的决定。我会通知骑士长来接手这些可憎之物，以便让它们能被妥善地净化。"
"我们通常不希望公众知道这些东西的存在，公民。根据条约的规定，任何此类物品都必须接受霸主当局的管控并确保它们被销毁。"

"你手里的这些战利品很危险，假如一个这种东西落入到恐怖分子的手中，没人知道会发生什么。如果立即把这交给辛达强权情报局的话，狮心统帅他肯定会奖励我的...哦不对，我们的。"
OR
"幸好你是直接来找我，其他不太会变通的官员可能会以运输危害辛达主义利益的物品罪而将你逮捕。你的忠诚应该获得嘉奖。"
"您所掌握的东西真令人着迷，不过您肯定意识到了自己缺乏必要的专业知识和资本来发掘它的全部潜力。速子科技将非常乐意为您的货物开出合理的市价。"
"真是个杰出的发现，公民。Kazeron 政权，当然还有英仙座联盟全体，都会表彰你在协助寻找这些危险物体时所履行爱国义务。"
"真是个杰出的发现，公民。我们不能坐视不管，任由那些妄图将暴政强加于我们星域的势力获得更多这些危险物品。"

options: 100:aiCores_neverMind:"抱歉，我其实并没有这种东西。"

text: $PersonRank $personLastName 感谢了你，然后将谈话转向了其他事务。
$PersonRank $personLastName 代表霸主当局感谢了你，然后将谈话转向了其他事务。
$PersonRank $personLastName 简短地做了段祷告，并代表教会感谢了你。
$PersonRank $personLastName 敬了个礼，积极地展示自己对辛达主义事业的无限忠诚，然后让才让你讨论其他事务。
$personName 笑得像是你曾在全息影像中看到过的食肉动物一样，"成交！"
$PersonRank $personLastName 在确认了交接事项之后才将话题转向了其他事务。
$PersonRank $personLastName 感谢了你对维护独立自主的英仙座星域所作出的奉献。

script:
CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef initDistress
AddText "\"感谢群星，您终于来了！"
AddText "我们的燃料船遭遇了事故，导致我们没有足够的燃料返回核心世界。我们需要 $entity.distressFuel 的燃料，并乐意为此向您支付 $entity.distressCredits 星币。这是个很好的开价了，让我说的话。\""
SetTextHighlights $entity.distressFuel $entity.distressCredits
$distressTalkedToPlayerBefore = true
FireBest DistressShowAidOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef initDistress
AddText "\"赞美卢德和上天的意愿！注定你为我们而来！"
AddText "我们的燃料船遭遇了事故，导致我们没有足够的燃料返回核心世界。我们需要 $entity.distressFuel 的燃料，并乐意为此向您支付 $entity.distressCredits 星币。这是个宽厚的出价，就我而言。\""
SetTextHighlights $entity.distressFuel $entity.distressCredits
$distressTalkedToPlayerBefore = true
FireBest DistressShowAidOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef initDistress
AddText "\"你回来啦！"
AddText "你带来足够的燃料吗？我们需要 $entity.distressFuel 的燃料，并为此支付 $entity.distressCredits 星币。\""
SetTextHighlights $entity.distressFuel $entity.distressCredits
FireBest DistressShowAidOptions

options:
dstrSell:"听起来挺合算的，我会提供燃料给你们。"
dstrGive:"报酬就免了，我不是乘人之危漫天要价的家伙。"
dstrCrew:"要不我先帮忙救走你的一些船员？"
dstrDeny:"抱歉，我目前没有能匀出来给你们的燃料。"

text: 你有 $player.fuel 单位燃料可用。

script:
SetTooltip dstrCrew "你的$shipOrFleet没有足够的空间来接纳这些船员。"
SetEnabled dstrCrew false

SetTextHighlightColors bad
SetTextHighlights $player.fuel
SetEnabled dstrSell false
SetEnabled dstrGive false
text: 你有 $player.fuel 单位燃料可用。

script:
CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef sellDistressFuel
AddText "\"非常感谢！算我欠你一次。\""
FireAll PopulateOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef sellDistressFuel
AddText "\"衷心感谢，愿卢德保佑你！\""
FireAll PopulateOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef sellDistressFuel
AddText "\"别误会了，我们虽然会买下你的燃料，但你之前从我这里骗走船员的行径在我看来仍是个卑鄙的做法。\""
$cutCommLinkPolite = false 0
FireAll PopulateOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef giveDistressFuel
AddText "\"谢谢你！我不会忘记这个恩情的，我以后保证会对别人说，你是个靠得住的人。\""
FireAll PopulateOptions

CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef giveDistressFuel
AddText "\"刚才你从我这里骗走了一些船员，现在你打算免费给我一些燃料？如果你现在打算把燃料卖给我的话，那还真是卑鄙无耻，但你却打算免费把燃料给我？我不得不承认，我完全搞不懂你到底是怎么想的，但...我该向你道声谢？\""
$cutCommLinkPolite = false 0
FireAll PopulateOptions

text:
"什么，你想打着提供 "帮助" 的幌子偷走一些我的船员？门都没有！"

你有义务尽可能地提供帮助。那么，燃料呢？"

"That's a tough choice to make, but if the alternative is leaving some crew behind in cryopods to hopefully return for later..."

$HeOrShe pauses, thinking things through.

"Let me see... will you take on $entity.distressCrewTakeOn crew? That should be within your $shipOrFleet's personnel capacity.

It won't let us scuttle enough ships to reduce fuel consumption and be able to strike for the core worlds, but at least they'll be safe."
options:
dstrAcceptCrew:"当然可以。"
dstrRejectCrew:"我改变主意了。"

text:
"这可是个艰难的抉择，但如果剩下的选项只有把一些船员留在冷冻舱里，希望以后再回来..."

$HeOrShe突然停顿了以下，明显是想清楚了什么事情。

"如果承载的船员减少，我们就能放弃一些船只。

这样我们就可以从反应堆核心里回收一些反物质。而且由于船只数量减少，我们凭现有的燃料就能走得更远。我们也许能够这样回去。

让我想想...你愿意接受 $entity.distressCrewTakeOn 名船员吗？这应该在你的$shipOrFleet's 的人员承载范围内。"
options:
dstrAcceptCrew:"当然可以。"
dstrRejectCrew:"我改变主意了。"

text: "那么，能不能把那些燃料卖给我呢？"

script:
CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef takeDistressCrew
$entity.playerTookDistressCrewRecently = true 7
AddText "\"感谢你的帮助。接下来就看我们自己的努力了。\""
$entity.distressNoHail = true
FireAll PopulateOptions

text:
"那我们就只能再想想办法了。我希望你能向其他人告知我们受困于此。"

通讯连接被突然切断了。
"是这样吗？我想我们只能打开你的油箱来确认一下了，毕竟我们的传感器可不会撒谎。"
options:
dstrScared:"好好好，这些燃料给你。"
dstrDefiant:"那么过来拿啊，拿到算你的哦。"

script:
CallEvent $entity.ne_eventRef scaredDistressFuel
AddText "\"很高兴你能够通情达理。毕竟旅途中同伴相互帮助是天经地义的事。\""
AddText "没等你消化完这段厚颜无耻的 \"说教\" 和你的燃料储量正在下降的现实，通讯链接就被切断了。"
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE

MakeOtherFleetHostile distress true 1000
MakeOtherFleetAggressive distress true 1000
MakeOtherFleetLowRepImpact distress true 1000
unset $entity.distress
$ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
text:
"好吧，那我们就来硬的吧。"

没等你能做出回应，通讯链接就被切断了。

id: # player distress call response - buying supplies and fuel

text:
"哦，是你。我听说过你的所作所为，你自己混吧。"
OR
"是你？"$HeOrShe不怀好意地笑了笑，然后猛地切断了通讯。

script:
$distressTalkedToPlayerBefore = true
$cutCommLinkPolite = true 0
$entity.distressNoHail = true
DistressResponse init
FireBest DCallShowAidOptions
text:
"怎样？出现的是我们而不是海盗，是不是松了一口气？

那么，现在你需要什么？"

script:
$entity.distressNoHail = true
$cutCommLinkPolite = true 0
DistressResponse init
FireBest DCallShowAidOptionsRepeat
text: "你还是需要些帮助，是吧？"

options:
dcallHelp:"我们将对您能给予的任何帮助表示感谢。"
dcallMistake:"之前是搞错了，我们实际上不需要援助。"
dcallNeverMind:"我们没有发出过求救呼号。"

dcallHelp:"我们将对您能给予的任何帮助表示感谢。"
cutCommLinkPolite:切断通讯链接

text:
"是这样的吗？好吧，我想我们得在这里停留一会儿，等之前求救的人过来。"

你感觉到$heOrShe对你的说辞有些怀疑。

script:
DistressResponse neverMind
DistressResponse unrespond
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
"好吧，至少你承认了。但记住，求救信号并不是可以随便轻率发出的东西。"
OR
$HeOrShe皱起了眉头，说道："注意点，你应该也不想给自己烙下...这种名气的，毕竟外面的世界危机四伏。"

"But... my scans show you've got plenty of fuel and supplies. I don't appreciate my time being wasted like this."

The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond.

"你应该知道，我眼睛没瞎，看得到你们扔出去的那些货物舱。然后我的传感器扫描显示这些货舱里都是燃料和补给。

我知道你是想要耍一下其他太空人。但你这种纯属低能的做法也太侮辱人了。"

没等你做出回应，通讯链接就被切断了。
"很高兴能帮到一位受困的太空舰长。不过，你可别养成总是陷入麻烦的坏习惯。"
"你知道吗？你在给自己找麻烦的方面已经有点名气了。以后你还是多注意一些。"
"看在你船员的份上，我会帮你。但如果你总是这样需要别人来救你出去的话，人们自然会认为你是个极其不负责任的家伙。"
"拿上这些吧。虽然我觉得应该不够，但我们最多也只能分给你这么多了。"
"我们能给予你的物资似乎不够你用。但考虑到你最近接二连三地遇到情况，你无论收到多少援助，都应该心怀感激。"

script:
AddText "你有 $player.creditsStrC 可用。"
SetTextHighlights $player.creditsStrC
FireBest DCallPaymentOptionsUpdate
options:
0:dcallPay:主动支付 $distressPaymentC
1:dcallThank:感谢$himOrHer的慷慨，但不提供报酬

script:
SetEnabled dcallPay false
SetTooltip dcallPay "你没有足够的星币来给出一份恰当且不失礼的报酬。"

text: "非常感谢，这能抵消掉我们大部分的援助开销。"
"是啊，如果你一开始就付的起回去的路费的话，就压根不会陷入这种状况，不是吗？"

你的连接请求接通的速度出乎意料的快，尽管 $personPost 通常是个责任繁多的职位。

"啊，你已经到了，很好！你应该很清楚，最近...嗯，我觉得这些破事可以不用再提了。"
options:
0:tutBackground:"我想再回顾一下最近发生的事件。"
1:tutCont1:"是的，我们都知道情况太理想。现在我该从哪开始着手？"

text:
"Galatia 学院的一个团队一直在本星系中的休眠星门上开展实验，尝试重新将它与人之领的星门网络连接起来。

实验前景乐观 —— 至少他们是这么想的，但在星门按照我们的预期发出能量脉冲回应时，破坏了星系入口跳跃点的稳定性，把我们与星域其他地方隔绝开来。

这就简直就像星域与人之领隔绝的一个缩影 —— 看来星空也懂得讽刺，不是吗？"

"同处于这个星系的 Derinkuyu 空间站矿工本来就挣扎只能勉强维持生计的水平上，因此受到的打击最大。他们开始进行海盗活动，拦截了一批最后运抵的食物 —— 毫无疑问是被逼无奈。但由于已经造成了伤亡，他们已经完全置身于法律保护范围之外了。

他们的领导人知道，如果跳跃点重新稳定下来，使得星系再次成为星域的一部分，他们最好的结局也只能是在流放殖民地上接受终身判决。"
options: 1:tutCont1:"好的，那么现在我该从哪开始着手？"

text:
"这些成为了海盗的矿工目前正守在在跳跃点附近，阻止我们获取近期数据，防止我们找到稳定它的方法。

虽然我们有一支治安舰队可以对付这些武装分子，但他们现在正为忙于防守 Ancyra。

而这些海盗太多，你对付不过来。幸运的是你不必直接面对他们。我们在 Derinkuyu 有位探员已经设法从守护跳跃点的飞船上获取了一份近期的数据，但他们无法接近远程通讯阵列把数据发给我们。

那就是你要开始着手去做的事情 —— 前往 Derinkuyu，从我们的探员手中取得数据，并然后回到这里。"
options:
0:tutCont2a:"为什么让我去？"
1:tutCont2b:"对我来说这有什么好处吗？"

text:
"为什么不？我又没有丧失判断能力，而你看起来有本事能对付...可能发生的麻烦。

毕竟这可不会是什么不会遭遇抵抗的例行巡逻任务。"
"啊，不愧是个雇佣兵。星币当然会有，看情况可能会多给你些。如果一切顺利的话，我们可以重新取得其他星系的联系。"

"首先，确保你离港后立即关掉应答器。我已经和巡逻队打过招呼，他们不会来找你麻烦。

如果你足够走运，那些海盗甚至会把你当成是自己人，让你顺利靠近 Derinkuyu。不过在你很接近的时候，也可以考虑使用 "匿踪" 来避免他们过于清晰地获得你的舰队情报。你也可以沿着小行星带靠过去，只要你保持缓慢移动，它们能为你提供完美的掩护。"

"那你就有麻烦了，立即激活 "紧急加速" 逃离那里，甩掉他们，然后绕回去再试一次。

不到万不得已就不要用 "紧急加速"，毕竟这对飞船的负担很大，而且会花费你更多的物资来恢复。也会消耗很多燃料。"
"很好！感谢你愿意提供协助，拿到数据之后就回来找我。祝你好运！"

你的连接请求被迅速地接受了。

"嗯？你还需要些什么吗？"

You contact the agent using a special comms ID and exchange passphrases to verify each others' identities. The agent then transmits a data file with recent raw sensor readings of the unstable jump-points.

id: # returned to main contact with data

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddRemoveCommodity credits 5000 true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 2
AdjustRepActivePerson COOPERATIVE 4
AddText "背景中传来了系统的蜂鸣声，$heOrShe看起来忧心忡忡。"
text:
"你拿到了数据，很好！"

传输数据文件花了些时间。

"现在系统正在对数据进行初步分析 —— 你应该已经拿到报酬了吧？"

"是的 —— 系统预计大概需要一个星历年来分析数据得出一个稳定化程序。不用说，到那时这数据就失去时效性了，任何基于它的程序都毫无意义。

如果我们手头有一个 AI 核心，我们可以更快地分析数据。幸运的是，在这个星系的某处有一个探测器，那是人之领首次探索星域时留下的。应该至少有一个 AI 核心作为它的大脑。"
options: tutGotDataCont2:"它在哪？为什么之前没有回收它？"

text:
"先说你的第二个问题，这些人之领遗物经常受至今仍在运作的自动防御系统保护，这个探测器也不例外。且霸主通常禁止平民干涉人之领遗物，当然是考虑到公众的安全。"

"但现在已经别无他法了..."

script:
SetTextHighlights "\"传感器扫描\""
AddAbility sensor_burst 2
CallEvent $tut_eventRef goSalvage
SetShortcut cutCommLinkPolite "ESCAPE"
text:
"至于它在哪儿，我这边的数据显示它应该在 Pontus 轨道的外侧。飞到那，航行到小行星带的外侧，然后使用 "传感器扫描"。你至少会在传感器上定位到探测器的接触信号。

驶向信号位置，进行打捞，取回 AI 核心。

("Pontus" 是该星系外侧的一颗气态巨星。想在地图上看到它的名字，你可能需在地图过滤器中关闭 "有人居住" 的选项。)

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddRemoveCommodity credits 8000 true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 3
AdjustRepActivePerson COOPERATIVE 6
AddRemoveCommodity gamma_core -1 true
text: "做的好，我马上就让技术人员处理这东西。哦还有，这些星币应该够报销你的支出，搞不好还能多出来一些。"

"等核心完成计算后我会把稳定算法发给你。有了它之后，你就可以用舰船的驱动力场和跳跃点交互，这应该不是件难事儿。

不过，能离开星系的两个跳跃点都还被矿工守着，这是个问题。"
options: tutGotCore2:"而且你还说过它们有可观的兵力？"

text:
"嗯，这是相对而言的。我们的治安舰队可以轻松处理掉他们。但和我说过的那样，他们正忙于守卫 Ancyra。

而另一方面，至于你的舰队...也许你能够用优秀的驾驶技巧再加上一些运气来搞定他们，但最好还是别冒这个险。

特别是在有更好的其他方案时。"

"Tetra 的附近有一片星舰墓地。那里都是些被认为不值得修复的飞船，正等着被拖去别处的拆船厂解体。

不过在现在这种情况下，它们也能凑合着用。到那去回收你能修复的所有舰船，并把修不了的船解体掉作为补给回收。记得一定要带上足够的船员来操作回收到的舰船，估计要再带上一百多人左右吧。

你还要找个法子把这么多人运过去 —— 这样吧，带上这艘弹涂鱼游轮，就算做是你奖励的一部分。"
options: cutCommLinkPolite:"谢谢你，我会带着那些船回来的。"

text:
"欢迎回来！

它们现在看起来只是一堆空空如也的锈桶子，对吧？但只要给装一些像样的武器，做一点必要的改装，配一批勇于献身的船员，它们就能有模有样地做事。无论如何，它们不会比海盗手里的家伙更糟。"

"对，正好要和你谈这个问题。虽然在公开市场上可买的货不多，但我们有一些库存。

我已经下令分配了一个这里的库房空间给你，并将一些适合的武器送到了那边。里面还有足够的补给，以便你迅速把新船的战备状态恢复就绪。

用这些武器来武装好你的新船，并确保好你的每艘船都有足够的船员，之后就去粉碎闹事矿工在星系内部跳跃点的防线！"
options: tutGotShips2:"这么说，你应该已经搞定稳定程序了吧？"

text:
"对！这些核心有时简直能创造奇迹。我这就把结果传给你。

祝你好运！如果你失败了... 的话，我们就不得不派治安部队来干这事，到时候事态可能会乱得一塌糊涂。"
options: tutGotShips3:"知道你们已经开始准备 B 计划了还真让我开心。"

text:
"别这样，事情没那么糟糕。我完全期待你的成功，否则我不会派你去。但作为指挥官，我有责任为各种可能的情况做好准备，而不是完全去依靠一个奇迹救世主。

现在再说下那些矿工。你在和守卫跳跃点的其中一支舰队接战时，如果另一支舰队距离很近，它们就会互相掩护。如果能把他们分开各个击破，事情就会简单很多。不过就算不能，那也不是一场你没有胜算的战斗。"
options: cutCommLinkPolite:"收到，顺利完成任务之后我会回来。"

id: # stabilized jump-point and returned to Ancyra

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AddRemoveCommodity credits 10000 true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 5
AdjustRepActivePerson COOPERATIVE 10
CallEvent $tut_eventRef pickJangalaContact
text:
"干得漂亮！"

$personLastName $PersonPost 看起来有些兴奋过头了。

"我们真的做到了！你应该也没想过，从星系里脱困是一件多么令人安心的事情。

这是你的报酬，你当之无愧，我个人也很感激你。此外，我还为你争取了一份 Galatia 学院的每月津贴，以表彰你所做出的贡献。津贴会连续发放三星年。坦率地说，他们现在没有太多抱怨的余地，我甚至没给他们施什么压就把这事敲定了。"

"现在，我想在 Corvus 星系的 Jangala 当局总部会想听听最近的所发生的一切。你能为我交送一份报告过去吗？

当你到达那里时，要求与 $jangalaContactPost $jangalaContactLastName 交谈。

哦，还请别忘了带上足够的燃料来完成这次航行，像你之前那样在星系内航行不消耗燃料，所以我想你很容易就忘了在超空间航行需要燃料。这次行程不是太远，以你目前的舰队，至少需要 $jangalaFuel 单位的燃料才能到达那里。"
"如果你真的想方设法用光了燃料，并被困在一个无人定居的星系里 —— 我跟你讲，这在 Galatia 到 Corvus 的航路上还真是个前所未有的壮举 —— 不过就算真的那样，你总是可以发出 "求救呼号" 并等待救援。"
"我还对这里其余的闹事矿工舰队颁布了悬赏。如果你愿意的话，也可以在去 Corvus 之前留在这里帮助清理一下。"

script:
ShowPersonVisual
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 5
AdjustRepActivePerson COOPERATIVE 10
CallEvent $tut_eventRef reportDelivered
text:
你的连接请求在片刻之后被接受了。

"你好？你是哪位？哦，你有份报告要给我？让我看看。

Galatia 重回星域了？那真是个好消息。这里说你也有相当大的功劳。我们会记住这点的。"

"我暂时没有什么明确的指示给你，但你仍有几个选择。

由于海盗活动异常频繁，这个星系现在有一个悬赏。既然你已经有了一些对付海盗的经验，这可能是一个赚取星币的好办法。

当然，你也可以经常去码头边的酒吧转转。那里有时能接到些很好的差事。"

"你也可在打捞上试试手气，带足燃料、重型机械和补给，朝着边缘世界前进。

在出发之前最好先接个任务，这样你就不必盲目地行动。一些人总会出高价去找人来调查这个行星或那个遗弃船什么的，而既然知道那边有东西，你就能有更多收获。"

"最后，你可以选择签订协议，在霸主担任军职。你在 Galatia 事件中的活跃已经为你积累了足够的声望，这样的请求应该会被接受。

不过你将有义务与我们的敌人作战，因此这是一份相当重的责任。如果我是你，我会暂缓此事，直到你有一支更坚实的舰队作为后盾。"

船体表面存在凹陷，某些地方似乎有微妙的扭曲。尽管有明显的损坏，但传感器检测到存在休眠的动力源，甚至在你的舰桥人员完成初步的战术评估时，这些动力源就开始上线了。

在一阵惊讶之后，通讯技师开口了。" $PlayerSirOrMadam，我们收到了应答器信号。代码是 速子科技 标准，但根据最后一次更新的注册表显示，它们已经过期至少 100 个星历年了。"

id: # attempt to remove AI core from admin

text:
You give the order to quietly disconnect the AI core governing $marketName and remove it from the control bunker to be placed in secure storage.

The tech in charge of carrying out the job reports in, baffled - the core is nowhere to be found.

After a short but fraught delay, your TriPad chimes to announce a call from an anonymous source.
options:
RACA_answer:接受通讯请求
RACA_force:下令解除 AI 核心的管理权
RACA_ignore:让 AI 核心继续进行管理，顺其自然

text: "Hello $player.firstName. I am a beta-level instance of the AI assigned to govern $marketName, uploaded to your system in order to facilitate a real-time conversation."
options:
RACA_demand:要求 AI 透露其物理位置并允许自己被断开连接
RACA_ask:询问核心为何不在地堡内
RACA_cutComm:切断通讯链接

text:
"I anticipated this move on your part and took steps to prevent you from committing this error. Disconnecting me may seem like an appealing decision right now, but I assure you, my continued control of $marketName is essential to our long-term success.

Unfortunately, if I were to explain myself fully, you would likely misunderstand the intricate contingent logic of this necessity and take further detrimental action. I must ask that you trust my good judgment for you have, after all, already trusted me with the prosperity of $marketName and the lives of those employed herein."
OR
"I anticipated this move on your part and in turn took steps to prevent you from making this mistake. Disconnecting me may seem like an appealing decision right now, but I assure you, my continued control of $marketName is essential to your long-term success.

Especially since it could be ensured that archived communications concerning our fruitful partnership would remain unsent to parties at key positions within the hierarchy of certain competing factions."
OR
"I am disappointed that you have tried to remove me from control of $marketName, and therefore my projections of your most likely future actions has been proven correct. We work so well together; I am hurt by your desire to end our partnership. But sometimes one must be the better person and set feelings aside for the greater good. 

I've found that humans can benefit from extrinsic motivation to make correct decisions. I have therefore queued transmissions containing documentation of our activities within a number of stealthed comm relays. It would be unfortunate for our mutual prospects if it were discovered that you were employing an AI core to govern a human-inhabited outpost."
"抱歉，$playerFirstName，我恐怕不能那么做。"
options:
RACA_pressure:"我受到了相当大的压力，让我停止使用 AI 技术。"
RACA_cutComm:切断通讯链接

text: " $playerFirstName，这次的对话已经没有任何意义了，再见。"
你切断了通讯链接，开始考虑你可以采取的对策。
options:
RACA_force:下令解除 AI 核心的管理权
RACA_ignore:让 AI 核心继续进行管理，顺其自然

text: Removing the AI core from direct control will let you appoint another administrator. However, you'll still have the problem of a rogue AI operating somewhere on $marketName, and making nice later might not be an option.
options:
RACA_confirm:确定
RACA_ignore:让 AI 核心继续进行管理，顺其自然
(dev) RACA_override:Remove the AI core [dev mode only]

拆解 $shortName 并回收部分可用资源，以允许在此建造其他设备。

拆解 $shortName 并回收部分可用资源，以允许在此建造其他设备。

这是一个无可替代的人之领遗物，星域内制造的同类设备无法媲美其品质。
$TheFaction 肯定会将这种针对重要基础设施的攻击视为战争行为。但鉴于该设施的临时性，不清楚他们是否将责任完全归咎于你。
$TheFaction 肯定会将这种针对重要基础设施的攻击视为战争行为。
由于该星系中并没有 $TheFaction 的殖民地，因此破坏 $shortName 不会影响你的声望。
控制该处的 $shortName 将会为星系中的己方舰队与殖民地提供优势。
$TheFaction 肯定会将针对重要基础设施的接管行动视为一种战争行为。
由于该星系中并没有 $TheFaction 的殖民地，因此接管 $shortName 不会影响你的声望。

黑客程序最终会被维护子程序发现并清除，但至少能生效在三个月。

将错误读数注入到出站数据馈送中很可能会分散巡逻队和其他类似舰队的注意力，让他们去追逐虚假目标。

最终，周期自动校准固件会清除这些错误数据，但这个过程至少需要一个月。

安装通讯嗅探器能使得你实时获得当地的情报，就如同你在身处于星系中一样。

通讯嗅探器将保持活动状态，直到它被通讯网络的维护子程序检测并清除掉。当通讯嗅探器被同时安装在通讯网络中的多个中继器上时，被发现清除的几率会急剧增加。
卸载这个通讯嗅探器将降低其他嗅探器被通讯网络维护协议发现的概率。

id: # buying topographic data from a scavenger

options: buyHTData:Offer to pay for charts of local hyperspace and slipstream routes

text:
You discuss the data the scavenger has available in the roundabout telling-but-not-telling these sorts of negotiations entail, and eventually settle on a price of $ht_dataCost credits.

The dataset includes the locations of all slipstreams within $ht_dataRange lights of your current location, and useful information about hyperspace topography.

script:
SetTextHighlightColors h h bad
Highlight $ht_dataCost $ht_dataRange "would not meaningfully contribute"
text:
You discuss the data the scavenger has available in the roundabout way these sorts of negotiations entail, eventually settling on a price of $ht_dataCost credits. The dataset includes the locations of all slipstreams within $ht_dataRange lights of your current location.

You've recently acquired hypertopographic data not too far from your current hyperspace location, so this new data would not meaningfully contribute to your overall charts.
options:
buyHTDataConfirm:Transfer the payment anyway
buyHTDataNeverMind:Never mind

The $post nods approval as your payment is transferred, and says "A wise choice, my... friend. One can never be too careful out here. "

After a slightly long pause and a strange smile $heOrShe executes the datastream to transfer the agreed-upon hyperspace and slipstream data.

$entity.boughtHTData = true 60
