text:
"This job is for a trade fleet. The owner needs to receive a stern message." 

$HeOrShe pulls up what looks like an internal customs inspection order, with attached fleet disposition report. "We've put in a word to a, ah, friendly officer in the customs department to hold them up for inspection in the $bcb_systemName, $bcb_dist light-years away." $HeOrShe smirks, "Very convenient, that. Less convenient is the patrol on guard to ensure they don't leave too soon, so I'll leave it to you to figure out how to get around that little complication."

"You'll get $bcb_reward credits for taking them out. The time frame is tight - you've got at most $bcb_days days before they get around to the inspection, and then they'll get away. How's that sound?"

"Just look at this do-gooder." $HeOrShe pulls up a standard ID holo of a military officer in uniform. "Too upright and honest to know when it's time to compromise a bit to make things easier on everyone. Get paid, look the other way, doesn't hurt anyone who doesn't deserve it, right?" $personName shakes $hisOrHer head at stubborn law-abiders.

"$bcb_TargetHeOrShe's commanding a $bcb_patrolFaction patrol fleet operating out of $bcb_targetMarketName in the $bcb_systemName, $bcb_dist light-years away. You'll find $bcb_targetHimOrHer patrolling either near there, a nearby jump-point, or one of their orbital strategic assets like a comm relay and the like."

$HeOrShe dismisses the ID holo with a contemptuous flick. "Take $bcb_targetHimOrHer out. You'll get $bcb_reward credits. I'll give you $bcb_days days to complete the job. Think you can handle that?"

$HeOrShe展示了一张在港口大厅拍摄的模糊全息照片。"这个雇佣兵给我一个朋友的行动带来了很多麻烦。我想让你帮忙解决我朋友的问题...一劳永逸地解决。"

$PersonName 将照片拉到了一边，然后打开了星图。"我们诱使$bcb_targetHimOrHer去 $bcb_dist 光年外的 $bcb_systemName 调查一些虚无缥缈的东西。$bcb_TargetHeOrShe现在应该觉得$bcb_targetHeOrShe能在那找到一些先进武器的藏匿点。"$heOrShe无情地笑着。

"我安排这件事是为了帮我的朋友一个忙，我的朋友同意向任何接受工作的人支付 $bcb_reward 星币。任务时间为 $bcb_days 天。你能处理好吗？"
A $lpt_manOrWoman in finely made Luddic pilgrimage robes seems to be speaking to various ship captains.

options: lpt_startBarRich:Approach the pilgrim wearing fine Luddic robes

text: A $manOrWoman in the ragged robes of a Luddic pilgrim seems to be approaching ship captains only to be turned away.

options: lpt_startBarPoor:Approach the Luddic pilgrim wearing ragged robes

text:
You approach the pilgrim, who smiles and puts $lpt_hisOrHer hands together. From $lpt_hisOrHer confident disposition and quality clothing it is clear that $lpt_heOrShe comes from wealth somewhat at odds with Ludd's ascetic reputation.

"Blessed day. Captain, I presume?" $lpt_heOrShe says. "I wish to arrange transport for myself and my party to the shrine of $lpt_entityName in the $lpt_systemName. I can, of course, provide payment. Would $lpt_reward credits be worth a journey of $lpt_dist lightyears?"

You approach the pilgrim. Finally seeing someone who looks like they want to talk, $lpt_heOrShe produces a crooked smile and puts $lpt_hisOrHer calloused hands together.

"May Ludd bless you, $playerSirOrMadam," $lpt_heOrShe says, bowing. "I beg of you for passage for myself and a small party to the shrine of $lpt_entityName. We are but poor pilgrims and cannot pay, so we beg this as charity from you."  

"Perhaps you are already traveling to the $lpt_systemName? The shrine would be but a short detour." $lpt_HeOrShe looks up at you hopefully. "We will cause no trouble, and will pray for Providence to bless you with prosperity and health."
You have your purser make arrangements, with instructions to keep the pilgrims from interfering in $shipOrFleet operations.

script:
Call $lpt_ref updateData
$player.hasTransportedPilgrims++
$lpt_completed = true 0
$option = lpt_deliverNonMarketContinue2 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected

text: Your purser reports that the pilgrims you picked up on $lpt_sourceName to transport to the local Luddic shrine have been offloaded to a civilian shuttle.

Your purser reports that the pilgrims you picked up from $lpt_sourceName have been offloaded to a private shuttle and are on their way to the local Luddic shrine. Their payment has forwarded to your accounts.

script:
$player.lpt_gotPilgrimShrineTip = true
AdjustRep luddic_church FAVORABLE 1
Call $lpt_ref updateStage
text:
The leader of the pilgrims you have transported from $lpt_sourceName insists on having the 'excellent captain' see $lpt_hisOrHer group off.

"You should visit the shrine, captain," $lpt_heOrShe insists. "I was once an unbeliever; the experience is quite transformational."

"Of course, I understand that this is a journey you must choose to undertake for yourself." $lpt_HeOrShe flashes a perfect smile and makes a pious gesture, then offloads to a private shuttle $lpt_heOrShe has hired to transport $lpt_himOrHer and $lpt_hisOrHer party to the shrine.

You receive report that the pilgrims you transported here from $lpt_sourceName have been offloaded to a civilian shuttle dedicated to charitable service for Faithful of humble means.

Whether you like it or not, they promised to pray for you for your act of charity.
Your purser reports that the pilgrims you picked up on $lpt_sourceName to transport to the local Luddic shrine have been offloaded to a civilian shuttle.

Your purser reports that the pilgrims you picked up from $lpt_sourceName have been offloaded to a private shuttle and are on their way to the local Luddic shrine. Their payment has forwarded to your accounts.

script:
$player.lpt_gotPilgrimShrineTip = true
AdjustRep luddic_church FAVORABLE 1
Call $lpt_ref updateStage
text:
The leader of the pilgrims you have transported from $lpt_sourceName insists on having the 'excellent captain' see $lpt_hisOrHer group off. "You should see the shrine, captain," $lpt_heOrShe insists. "I was once an unbeliever; the experience is quite transformational."

$lpt_HeOrShe flashes a perfect smile, "Of course, I understand that this is a journey one must choose for oneself." $lpt_HeOrShe makes a pious gesture, then offloads to a private shuttle $lpt_heOrShe has hired to transport $lpt_himOrHer and $lpt_hisOrHer party to the shrine.

You receive report that the pilgrims you transported here from $lpt_sourceName have been offloaded to a civilian shuttle dedicated to charitable service for Faithful of humble means.

Whether you like it or not, they promised to pray for you for your act of charity.

"我需要将 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName。必须谨慎行事。"
OR
"我需要在不惊扰当局的情况下，将 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName。"

options: smug_start:打探关于秘密走私行动的消息

text: 酒吧里，一个可疑的$smug_manOrWoman正在用杂牌数据平板烦扰着看起来就对此没有丝毫兴趣的星舰舰长。

options: smug_startBar:看看那个带着杂牌数据面板的可疑的$smug_manOrWoman在为了什么而问东问西

script:
$missionId = smug
SetTextHighlights $smug_quantity $smug_dist $smug_reward
ShowRemainingCapacity $smug_commodityId
Call $smug_ref showMap "目的地：$smug_marketName "
text:
当你走近时，那个$smug_manOrWoman暂时停止了和他人的攀谈，把$hisOrHer的注意力转移到了你身上。

"那边那位，舰长。果然，诚实的人一眼就能看出来！"$HeOrShe歪嘴笑了笑，"你看，"$heOrShe把闪烁的数据平板递到了你的手中：上面显示的货物清单记录着存储在另一个星系的仓库里的低档建筑材料。

$HeOrShe靠了过来，轻声解释着数据平板上的内容，"你帮我把 $smug_quantity 个单位的 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName，仅在 $smug_dist 光年外，很近。然后我会付你 $smug_reward 星币。不涉及当局，没有检查，没有关税。很容易到手的一笔钱，对吧？"

script:
$missionId = smug
SetTextHighlights $smug_quantity $smug_dist $smug_reward
ShowRemainingCapacity $smug_commodityId
Call $smug_ref showMap "目的地：$smug_marketName "
text: "我需要将 $smug_quantity 单位的 $smug_commodityName 移动到 $smug_marketName，那位于 $smug_dist 光年外。必须要谨慎；不能让当局知道货物的事。送货完成后你能收到 $smug_reward 星币。"

You order the cargo of $smug_commodityName dropped off at an abandoned spacedock, far from prying eyes. Your flagship soon receives acknowledgement of the delivery from a disposable commsat.
OR
A converted surface-to-orbit passenger transport pulls alongside your $fleetOrShip's orbit after you give the planned signal. The cargo of $smug_commodityName is quickly transferred by robot drones running without nav transponders, then the transport pulls away.

script:
$smug_noCompleteShown = true 0
SetTextHighlightColors bad bad
Highlight "需要关闭应答器" "不引起巡逻队的注意"
FireBest MarketPostDock
text: 递送 $smug_commodityName 时需要关闭应答器，并且避开巡逻队的注意。
你没有足够的 $smug_commodityName 来完成交付。
"STRATCOM 想找人帮忙。他们似乎想要瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，以此为某些更进一步的计划做准备。"

options: dhi_start:询问瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry 这一计划的细节

text: 你在一个私人隔间里认出了 $TheFaction 的一个高级军官 —— 看起来他们也认出了你，其中一个副官被派过来邀请你过来 "聊聊"。

你跟着副官走进了包间；他们敬了个礼，然后再度朝吧台走去。

"舰长。" $personName $Rank 以一种质朴的方式欢迎着你。"坐吧，不必拘谨。"$HeOrShe伸手去够装着凉水的罐子。$HeOrShe看上去总是随时待命的状态。

"STRATCOM 需要一支非常规部队来瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，至少持续 $dhi_disruptDays 天。"对方在数据平板上轻敲了几下，接着一张全息图浮现了出来。情报十分全面：估计的驻军规模和防御布置。"目标距离这里 $dhi_dist 光年。特别行动办公室已经同意，如果你能完成任务，你将能得到 $dhi_reward 星币。"

你看着那些数据，估计大约需要 $dhi_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这项任务。$faction $rank 在你进行评估时耐心地等待着你的回复。

$HeOrShe打开了显示器，上边的情报十分全面：估计的驻军规模和防御布置。"我们需要一支非常规部队来瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，至少持续 $dhi_disruptDays 天。"对方在数据平板上轻敲了几下，一张地图覆盖了之前的信息。" 目标距离这里 $dhi_dist 光年。特别行动办公室对该任务的奖励是 $dhi_reward 星币。"

你看着情报，估计大约需要 $dhi_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这项任务。$faction $rank 在你进行评估时耐心地等待着你的回复。

You feel the almost imperceptible vibrations as the assault shuttles return to your $shipOrFleet, their work complete. You listen for a moment to the open broad-comm channel; the line crackles and squeals with the last gasps of electronic warfare hexes distorted through chaff and the warp of fresh plumes of charged particles. It's a familiar sound; you can almost smell it. 

Tactical has casualty reports prepared for review. You acknowledge with a nod and shut off the comms.
"这有一项很重的任务，并且我愿意为此提供相当丰厚的报酬：我需要人去瘫痪 $dsp_marketName 上的 $dsp_industry。"
"鉴于我们已经互相信任，我就直说了：在 $dsp_marketName 上搞出一些麻烦会对我的计划有帮助，你能帮我瘫痪那里的 $dsp_industry 吗？酬劳是不会少的。"

options: dsp_start:询问瘫痪 $dsp_industry 一事的细节

text: 某个黑道大佬懒洋洋地躺在一个小隔间里，从旁边那些盯着任何胆敢靠近的人的保镖就可以看出来，恐怕在那能接到的不是什么好工作。

options: dsp_startBar:看看隔间里的黑道大佬会让你搅什么浑水

text:
当你靠近时，一个接受过生化改装的暴徒拦住了你，脸上挂着无机感十足的笑容，仿佛因为自己终于可以揍人而感到十分开心。一直跟着你的一个保镖则感觉这就是自己受雇于你的理由，快步走了过来。

你的人有着更好的战斗技巧，而对方只是在接受非正规生化改装后徒有凶相的暴徒罢了。

隔间里，一阵轻快的掌声响起。"精彩的表演，干得漂亮。尽管我看多了血腥斗殴，这次我还是连酒都忘了喝一口。"然后对方对暴徒说："你！退下 —— 舰长，过来吧。"

$personName 喜欢谈论$himOrHerself 自己的事，并且对这样做不需要他人的意见一事感到很满足，这个 "他人" 可以是其他旁听的暴徒，也可以是你。

谈话最终转到了你和对方的保镖之间的对峙。"似乎你在经营舰队方面很有自己的一套，"$heOrShe说，谈论间几乎没有碰$hisOrHer的饮料。

第二杯咖啡摆在了你面前，你礼貌地啜了一口以免自己忘了这玩意儿。"十分干练的保镖，非常专业。或许也有很高的薪水？"$HeOrShe挑起了眉毛，在你能做出回应之前继续说道。"我正需要这些。你看 —— 大部分的强盗、土匪以及海盗，他们过于草率，把事情搞得一团糟，声势浩大但虎头蛇尾。"

"看起来，你，"$heOrShe说，"可以为我做点什么。"

"我需要你的陆战队。瘫痪 $dsp_marketName 上的 $dsp_industry 至少 $dsp_disruptDays 天。那离这里 $dsp_dist 光年 —— 你知道那是哪里。这不是屠杀任务，也不是恐怖行动，只是生意相关，做的利索点。当行动目标意识到和平合作更为明智的时候，更多的利润就来了，不是吗？"

$HeOrShe摆出了一副认真的模样，好像在细细斟酌自己该为这个任务给出怎样的报酬好。" $dsp_reward 星币。"

你估计你需要大约 $dsp_marines 名陆战队员来完成这个任务。

"Like I said," $heOrShe says, "I require operation of the $dsp_industry $dsp_marketOnOrAt $dsp_marketName, $dsp_dist light-years away, disrupted for at least-" $heOrShe furrows $hisOrHer brow, considering. Then, with cold indifference, says "$dsp_disruptDays days. That should do it. If you carry out this task for me, I would reward you with $dsp_reward credits."

"So you can make an informed decision, here's tac-intel." $HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer datapad and soon you have a very competent recon overview on $dsp_marketName. You estimate that you'd need around $dsp_marines marines to carry off this raid.
该任务已按照 $dsp_personName 的要求完成，无论那人打算开始对对方进行什么敲诈或恐吓，这下应该有效得多了。
"STRATCOM 需要一支非常规部队对 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸，我认为你应该是干这事的合适人选。"

options: tabo_start:询问战术轰炸任务的细节

text: 一个穿着整洁制服坐在隔间里的高级官员和你对上了目光。对方的副官走向了你，"我的上司想和你商量一件事，$PlayerSirOrMadam，若是方便的话。"

options: tabo_startBar:过去看看那个高级官员想和你 "商量" 什么

text:
" $playerName 舰长，"$heOrShe在你走近时严肃地点点头，"你可是名声在外。"

$HeOrShe抿了一口水晶杯里的无色液体，然后轻触了几下$hisOrHer的数据平板，私人力场隔绝了声音，领域外的景象也变得模糊了起来。

"我需要一支精锐但不在编制内的舰队，以对 $tabo_dist 光年外的 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸。如果你能按照相关指示执行任务，$tabo_reward 星币将会汇到你的账户内。"

一只手拿着杯子，$faction $rank 又操作了几下数据平板，然后将它滑向了你。屏幕上显示着驻军人数，布防状况之类详细的情报。你查看了报告后估计你需要大约 $tabo_fuel 燃料来进行轰炸。$rank 注视着你，当你抬头时，对方扬起眉毛。"接这任务吗？"

"我奉命雇佣一支非正规舰队，对 $tabo_dist 光年外的 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸。我们知道你以前的工作都完成得很出色，也因此相信你能出色地完成这项任务，"$heOrShe说，"我们还拨出了 $tabo_reward 星币来作为你的酬劳。"

$HeOrShe轻触$hisOrHer的数据平板，共享的情报信息出现在了你的显示器上。你简要地浏览着情报，根据任务参数估计你需要大约 $tabo_fuel 燃料来执行轰炸任务。

$personLastName $rank 挥手划走了战术情报，看着你，"那么，你的决定是？"

$name 填满了你舰桥上的战术显示屏，四散的中空图标显示出了被解决的目标。很快最后一个目标的图标出现，你的任务完成了。

你轻轻挥了挥手，战术显示器上的图像消失。四散的全息噪点以你的$shipOrFleet为中心点，向外围快速重聚成了导航界面。

id: # Patrol encounter at some point afterwards

text: "你可别指望轰炸了 $entity.tabo_marketName 后没人会给出响应，" $rank 大胆地说。"现在准备战斗吧！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"如有不便，敬请谅解。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "你的下半辈子会因为对 $entity.tabo_marketName 进行这样的毁灭而受到审判。"这位 $rank 说着，双手紧握，充满虔诚。"愿上天指引我的手，让我为你带来判决！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"如有不便，敬请谅解。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "恶魔摩洛克的肮脏奴仆！"左径分子喊道，"上天正对我微笑，只因我的圣途已将我指引到你身边。我将挥舞卢德的正义铁锤，重击并粉碎你的舰队！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"你真的有读过卢德的布道辞吗？"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: 速子科技 $rank 露出的表情给人感觉像是$heOrShe闻到了什么难闻的味道。"这种...对公司财产的肆意破坏是对我们底线的直接攻击。我向你保证，你这个海盗，你这个土匪！你会付出双倍的代价！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"那将会是我与 速子科技 做的最大的一笔生意。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "你惹怒了老大，"海盗咆哮道。"你炸了老大的东西，还以为你能逃脱惩罚吗？没有人得罪了老大之后还能活着。"
options:
cutCommLink2:"我得承认，哪怕是现在我也觉得我能逃脱惩罚。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "我这里有最新的 $seco_faction 设施安全码。这些代码可以在进行地面行动时为你带来巨大优势。"
酒吧里，一个鬼鬼祟祟的$seco_manOrWoman正在摆弄着一个电子设备，对方在转身离开前给了你一个严肃但意味深长的眼神。

options: seco_startBar:去和摆弄电子设备的鬼鬼祟祟$seco_manOrWoman聊天

script:
$missionId = seco
SetTextHighlightColors $seco_factionColor h
SetTextHighlights $seco_faction $seco_price
DoCanAffordCheck $seco_price contact_acceptBar
text:
你假装在看菜单，$seco_manOrWoman放下电子设备，说$seco_heOrShe看见你的$shipOrFleet了，"你看起来像是会用到最新的 $seco_faction 设施安全码的人，"$seco_heOrShe眨了眨眼。

"一旦你用了这玩意儿，他们就会更改所有密码。不过那足够了，在适当的时候让安全系统瘫痪..."$HeOrShe停了下来，让你自己体会下半句：它会为你让地面行动中占有显著优势。"你必须得尽快使用，"$heOrShe耸了耸肩，"这些代码大概一个月更换一次，没什么特殊情况的话。"

$seco_manOrWoman说价格是 $seco_price 星币，这可比你手中菜单上的东西贵得多。

script:
$missionId = seco
SetTextHighlightColors $seco_factionColor h h
SetTextHighlights $seco_faction $seco_price $seco_days
DoCanAffordCheck $seco_price contact_accept
text: $HeOrShe阴森森地点了点$hisOrHer的头："我的一个 '朋友' 获得了一些安全码，它们可以让你在任何一次地面行动中占据上风 —— 当然，只要用了一次，对方就会立即改掉密码。我打算用 $seco_price 星币卖掉它们。必须为我的朋友承担风险，当然也包括合理的转售费。"在 $seco_days 天内使用安全码都是可以的。

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $seco_price
Call $seco_ref repSuccess
Call $seco_ref addContacts

id: # Patrol encounter at some point afterwards

text:
"We don't know how you got our codes," the $theFactionLong $personRank says, seething, "But I find such subterfuge a personal affront to my honor as a warrior. My orders are simply to hunt you down and destroy you, but know that I consider this a duel between an officer and an unscrupulous coward."

"Prepare your $shipOrFleet for combat, captain," $heOrShe spits. "Let us see how you do in a fair fight."
options:
cutCommLinkNoText2:嘟囔一些关于信息安全的东西
cutCommLinkNoText:保持沉默

text: "我制定了份万无一失的计划，可以从当地轨道的仓库中偷走一艘军用飞船。但先前谈好的买家放弃了交易。因此我可以把这些信息转卖给你，让你自己完成这项计划。"

options: hijack_start:询问关于偷取军用飞船的计划

text: 一个穿着动力盔甲内衬，长相彪悍的 $hijack_manOrWoman 正喝着刺鼻的酒，用凶狠的眼神恐吓任何试图靠近的人。

options: hijack_startBar:和穿着动力装甲内衬长相彪悍的$hijack_manOrWoman谈谈

text:
你走了过去，冷静地面对着对方那令人生畏的目光。那个$hijack_manOrWoman对你的冷静报以大笑，带着一股呛眼睛的酒味邀请你坐在$heOrShe身边。"我喜欢你，"$heOrShe对着酒吧里的人大喊，但被无视了，"你不是个孬种！"

你这位新交的好朋友一直在满嘴跑火车，但你惊讶地发现$heOrShe实际上比$heOrShe看上去的样子要聪明得多，因为$heOrShe在吹牛的时候看似不经意地发问刺探了你的背景和能力。

$heOrShe放轻了嗓门，但始终用双眼警戒着四周："我坦率地说吧，舰长。你进退有度，这我很欣赏。不知道你想不想和我一起干一票。"$HeOrShe咧开嘴微笑，露出了满嘴的钛合金牙。"要细说吗？"

"在一个守卫薄弱的轨道船坞里，有一艘 $hijack_hull $hijack_designation 正在吃灰。我制定了一个偷船的计划，但最初的赞助商临阵退缩了。就像我之前说的，胆小鬼。做了这么多准备，不去干就太浪费了，对吧？但一艘星际飞船对我没有任何用处。"

"机库的结构图、安全码、警卫轮值表，应有尽有。我甚至会亲自参加行动，这样你或许能放心一些。"

"我的开价是 $hijack_price 星币，没有商量的余地。你将需要准备至少 $hijack_marines 名陆战队员来让这任务顺利执行。我不认为会有积极的抵抗，但我们依然需要警惕每一个安保人员，免得被某些想逞英雄的人搞出乱子。你干不？"
options:
hijack_lookBar:询问目标舰船的细节
contact_declineBarNoContinue:拒绝

text:
"有一艘 $hijack_hull $hijack_designation 在一个没什么守卫的轨道船坞里吃灰。可能是什么征用单据搞错了之类的原因吧。所有的资料我都有，机库的结构图、安全码、警卫轮值表之类。我甚至会亲自参加行动，省得你觉得我耍花样。"

"我的开价是 $hijack_price 星币，没有商量的余地。你要准备至少 $hijack_marines 个陆战队员给我搞定这个计划。我觉得不会有什么像样的抵抗，但我们还是要确保压制所有守卫，免得被某些想逞英雄的人搞出乱子。你怎么想？"
options:
hijack_look:询问那艘战舰的细节
contact_decline:拒绝

script:
Call $hijack_ref showShip
DoCanAffordCheck $hijack_price hijack_op1
FireBest HijackNotEnoughMarines
text: $hijack_manOrWoman 在$hijack_hisOrHer的破旧 TriPad 上轻触了几下，目标舰船的相关数据就出现在了上面。"很能飞的家伙，不是吗？"

script:
Call $hijack_ref showShip
DoCanAffordCheck $hijack_price hijack_op1 false
FireBest HijackNotEnoughMarines
text: $personName 轻触了几下手中的电子设备，将目标舰船的相关数据分享给你。"看看吧。"$heOrShe说。
你没有足够的陆战队员来执行这次任务。

让两支队伍乘坐伪装成民用后勤无人机的穿梭机溜进轨道船坞非常简单。一颗出现得很不是时候的小陨石的撞击导致船坞里的基础通讯系统失灵了，然后一位拥有完整安全权限的 "某人" 的失误重置了机库的电力系统，使内部传感器和过时了几个世纪的门锁失去了作用。

你精心挑选的陆战队员们打了警卫一个措手不及。

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $hijack_price
AddShip $hijack_member
Call $hijack_ref repSuccess
Call $hijack_ref addContacts
text: 你在全息影像上看到 $personName 正透过$hisOrHer的数据平板咧嘴笑着，同时拉动了手动的停靠闸。你的新船从机库夹具中挣脱了出来，它全副武装的新船员们在主能源系统上线后开始操作舰桥控制台。

你回到酒吧，与 $personName 畅饮着对方喜欢用来庆祝的烈酒。

"真有趣，舰长！只要你愿意，我随时都可以和你一起再偷一艘船。"$heOrShe的声音大得周围的人都能听见，但他们还是聪明地装出没听见的样子。

在新船加入你的舰队后，你和 $personName 一起看着行动报告。

"一切按计划进行。"$HeOrShe笑得像个老海盗，"总有一天我们会再一起干一票的。"
"我想讨论对某个人的非必要监禁，以及可能采取什么措施来解决这个问题。"

options: jabr_start:询问具体要怎么解决 "监禁" 问题

text: 在阴暗的角落里，一个抽着大烟的$jabr_manOrWoman引起了你的主意。

script:
$missionId = jabr
SetTextHighlightColors h h h h $jabr_factionColor
Highlight $jabr_marketName $jabr_dist $jabr_reward $jabr_marines $jabr_marketFaction
Call $jabr_ref showMap "目标：$jabr_marketName "
text:
The $jabr_manOrWoman looks you over as you approach. After a moment, $jabr_heOrShe seems satisfied and slides a cheap datapad across the table. It displays a personnel file and the schematics of a secure facility.

In a quiet voice $jabr_heOrShe explains, "I need an extract of the subject from, ah, unjust confinement $jabr_marketOnOrAt $jabr_marketName, $jabr_dist light-years away. My benefactor offers a payment of $jabr_reward credits to secure the subject's liberation." The $jabr_manOrWoman awaits your reply, eyes visible only as two constellations of reflected light.

You skim the schematics; they're thorough. You estimate that around $jabr_marines marines would be required to carry off this operation. Assaulting $jabr_marketFactionArticle $jabr_marketFaction prison could also have an impact on your reputation; measures can be taken to reduce identifiability, but they can't completely avert official suspicion.

script:
$missionId = jabr
SetTextHighlightColors h $jabr_factionColor h
Highlight $jabr_dist $jabr_marketFaction $jabr_reward $jabr_marines
Call $jabr_ref showMap "目标：$jabr_marketName "
text:
"I would simply like you to extract the subject from confinement on $jabr_marketOnOrAt $jabr_marketName, located $jabr_dist light-years away. Doing it quietly would be preferable, but sometimes these matters escape our control. Try not to offend the $jabr_marketFaction too much; it would draw unwanted attention. Once you liberate the subject, you will receive $jabr_reward credits to your accounts."

"I suspect that they're expecting a break attempt, so I acquired this." $HeOrShe taps at a TriPad and your corresponding system receives detailed reports on the troop deployments and infiltration defenses of $jabr_marketName. A quick review suggests that you'd need around $jabr_marines marines to carry off the operation.

script:
AddRaidObjective genericIcon "实施越狱行动" $jabr_danger 3000 JABRRaidFinished
$jabr_addedRaidObjective = true 0
FireBest OpenInteractionDialog

text:
The target is disheveled, and looks to have gone some time without sleep. They have one of those perfectly ordinary faces; just another tech, clerk, or laborer that passes by on the transport tube. All that trouble, for this?

"Thank you captain," they give a wan smile as your guards lead them to a secure compartment, "I'm expected home now, I'm sure."

script: AddBarEvent jabr_barEvent "跟那个点了一杯叫 '囚犯' 的酒的顾客谈谈" "一个顾客大声点了一杯叫 '囚犯' 的东西并冲你笑了笑"

SetStoryOption jabr_storyOptionBar general "与这位叛变者商量释放囚犯的事"
Highlight $jabr_storyCost
DoCanAffordCheck $jabr_storyCost jabr_storyOptionBar false
text:
你走近那位面带微笑的顾客，对方转过身来，但眼睛依旧紧紧地盯着墙上展示的菜单，这时吧台上出现了一种有些奇特的饮品。

"可供选择的手段很多，$playerName，" 对方唐突而刻意地这么说道。"并非每个人的所求都完全一致的。有些人心中十分不满，但出于礼貌而没有大声说出来。" 对方的目光闪过了门口，然后投向了全息显示屏上有关 $jabr_marketName 上领导干部的新闻。

"也许你会喜欢我手上的东西？"对方长长地啜饮了一口，"这东西挺贵的，因为还有其他人也非常想得到它。价格是 $jabr_storyCost 星币。"
options:
jabr_storyOptionBar:贿赂微笑的顾客以获得囚犯
jabr_backToBar:返回酒吧

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $jabr_storyCost
$market.jabr_needToReturn = true
Call $market.jabr_ref updateStage
RemoveBarEvent jabr_barEvent
BarCMD returnFromEvent true
text:
你叫来酒保，点了杯 '多选一'。

顾客的脸上又出现了微笑。向全息显示屏点了点头，"上面这位朋友可真尴尬。"

你在安全通讯频道中与设施安保人员对上了暗号，并协商接头地点。对方承诺在下一次轮班开始之前交付目标。没等多久，当双手仍然被绑着的囚犯被从阴暗的维修通道中推到你面前时，你几乎和他一样惊讶。那位顾客在舱门重新密封之前倾身向你点了点头。

你们在公民识别网络标记出身份之前迅速离开了。
你 TriPad 的铃声响起，通知你首席安全官已经交出了囚犯，对方现在自由了，也许吧。
"我需要递送一个包裹，目的地必须保密。很简单的任务。"

options: ddro_start:询问秘密运输任务的细节

text: 在酒吧的一角，不少看起来生活水平不高的人在和一个潇洒的$ddro_manOrWoman碰头后几乎立刻就跑开了。对方似乎在发号施令。

options: ddro_startBar:看看那个潇洒的$ddro_manOrWoman在做什么

text:
$ddro_manOrWoman注意到了你的接近。"你也想参与这桩生意，对吗？"$heOrShe刚说完，就被你的大胆给逗乐了。

"先来个简单的活吧，就算你脑袋被辐射烤焦了也能办到。不过..."$heOrShe遗憾地耸了耸肩，"很多人就是因为不能遵守指示，才落得个被丢出气闸的下场，想起来还挺可惜的。"$HeOrShe突然哈哈大笑，如同这是个很棒的笑话那般。

"将东西送到 $ddro_dist 光年外的 $ddro_systemName。"$HeOrShe麻利地从外套里翻出了一个 TriPad，而上面正显示着 $ddro_aOrAnThing。"就这玩意儿。报酬是 $ddro_reward 星币。记住交货的时候不要被人看见，更不要走漏风声。"

$PersonName looks you over silently for a moment, then nods, seemingly satisfied.

"I don't want any questions, it's a simple task. Deliver this item to the specified location in $ddro_systemName, $ddro_dist light-years away. Don't be seen making the drop, and don't tell anyone about it. The reward is $ddro_reward credits." $HeOrShe taps at $hisOrHer datapad and your display is overlaid with $ddro_aOrAnThing. 

"That is all there is to it. Do you accept my terms?"
你的$shipOrFleet最近刚被侦测到或者正在被跟踪，现在递交物品到指定位置是非常不明智的。

导航技师向你告知，你的$shipOrFleet已经到达由 $ddro_personName 提供的坐标位置。$ddro_thing 已经被小心地安置到了货运无人机的机械臂上，随时准备投放。

执行按钮在你的命令界面上轻轻地闪烁。
options:
ddro_scan:把货扔到稳定轨道上
defaultLeave:离开

text:
舱门打开，货运无人机伸长它的机械臂，然后轻轻地松开了物品。

任务完成了，无论 "那东西" 是什么。
"我的一个线人告诉了我 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置。我愿意在价格合适的前提下与你分享这个信息。"
我的一个线人告诉了我 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置。但目前我不需要它，所以我愿意在价格合适的情况下与你分享得到它的机会。"
一个衣着浮夸的$manOrWoman从你身边挤了过去，请了整个酒吧一轮酒。那家伙在自己没披挂整齐的拾荒套装上摆显着各种搜刮来的小玩意儿。

options: sitm_startBar:感谢那个衣着浮夸的$manOrWoman请的酒

text:
"我在庆祝！"$HeOrShe靠了过来，"新发现。"$HeOrShe举起$hisOrHer的饮品，转过身笑嘻嘻地说，"继续喝吧，庆祝我的好运！"人们对这种自我祝酒的热情并不高，但依然有一群下班了的太空船员大呼小叫着。

$HeOrShe在太空船员们尖叫时喝下了饮料，然后看向你。"你看起来像是航行经验丰富的人，"$heOrShe又一次压低了$hisOrHer的声音。我知道 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置，$sitm_price 星币卖给你。只要带着你的$shipOrFleet过去，你就能拿走它。我也想去，但我舍不得离开文明世界。"

$HeOrShe轻敲着$hisOrHer的空饮料杯，目光寻找着酒保。"感兴趣吗？"$heOrShe漫不经心地问道。

script:
BarCMD accept $missionId
FireBest ContactPostAccept
BarCMD returnFromEvent true
text: 你付了钱后，$manOrWoman就找借口离开了。当你查看对方提供的目标所在位置时，酒保端着第二杯酒过来了，还叹了口气。"提醒你一下，朋友，这不是$heOrShe第一次这么干了。我想你不是唯一一个有藏宝图的人。"

$HeOrShe思考了一会儿，然后冷冷地说，"有件事我得告诉你，这种线人，他们不是完全可靠的。不要误解我的意思，我对所提供的信息的有效性很有信心 —— 我想说的是他们可能会把相同的数据卖给多个利益相关方。所以如果你要接受，你得准备好和其他寻宝者打交道。"

"目标所在位置的价格是 $sitm_price，十分合理。你觉得呢？"

$HeOrShe似乎在思考着什么，不一会后对方语气冰冷地开口了，"我希望我们之后能继续合作，所以我得给你个警告 —— 不要忽视它。为了将利益最大化，我已经把相同的数据卖给了多个利益相关方。所以如果你要接受，你得准备好和其他寻宝者打交道。"$HeOrShe露出了期待的微笑，"目标将远离核心世界；你可以直接干掉他们的舰队，掠夺他们的补给，怎么聪明怎么来。"

" $sitm_price 星币换位置信息，很合理。你要参加这个危险的游戏吗？"

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $sitm_price
Call $sitm_ref repSuccess
Call $sitm_ref addContacts

text:
"宝藏将属于我，而且只属于我一个人！你最好离远点，如果..."寻宝者搜寻着合适的词，"如果 —— 如果你想活命的话！"

当你还在思考该说什么时，通讯链接被唐突切断了。

"我告诉过你，我警告过你。"寻宝者语无伦次地说，"你得 —— 你得和我硬碰硬了。我告诉过你，我告诉过你的！你会后悔的。"

你还没来得及说话，通讯线路就又被切断了。看起来这个寻宝者社交能力不太行。

"不管拾荒者找到了什么，那些东西都将归我所有，我也许会为它们支付一些星币，"$heOrShe说，" —— 当然，那是在我觉得自己应该慷慨一些的时候。"$heOrShe看着你，脸上挂着难看的笑容，并稍微停顿了一下。

"而你呢，为了保住自己的小命，你需要离开这里..."

$HeOrShe沾沾自喜地说着这话，显然自信地认为这会让你转过身去，将引擎功率开到最大并落荒而逃。当你还在细细品味$hisOrHer那带有威胁性质的话语时，通讯链接突然被切断了。

"我警告过你，不想受罪的话就立马离开，"雇佣兵由于你根本没把$HeOrShe的话听进去而恼羞成怒，"现在我不得不把你暴打一顿，否则以后就没人把我的话当回事了。记住，这是你自找的！"

$HeOrShe在你能做出答复之前切断了通讯链接。

"恶魔摩洛克的邪恶手足！"左径分子吐了一口唾沫，"为何你胆敢插手应被忘却之事！卢德先知竟为你这样的愚者死于枉然了吗！"

$HeOrShe深吸了一口气。"神圣的真空，展现你的慈悲，因为我已无法遏制怒火！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"这是不可抗力，并非我愿意这么做。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

id: # similar - Pather encounter after recovering a blueprint OR special item that the historian told the player about

text:
"恶魔玛门的污秽奴仆！"左径分子啐了一口，"上天理应已将此等邪恶从人心中抹除！而今你却出现于此，侵吞恶魔之遗产，挖掘，掠夺...掠夺亵渎之财富！"

$HeOrShe深吸了一口气："卢德在上，请宽恕我的愤怒。"
options:
cutCommLink2:"宽恕可不能拿来付账。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

id: # GENERIC COMPLICATION of "fleet wants thing you have and need to complete a mission"

text:
The comms-link crackles to life. "Greetings, star-farer!" $Rank $personName grimaces regretfully, "Bad news: you possess something my superiors desire and now you must surrender it to me."

You realize that $heOrShe is talking about $entity.fwt_thingDesc.

"Now, is this going to be easy or hard? Think, now," $heOrShe says charitably, "But don't take too long, please."
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_accept:交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
"Bright stars, captain. I regret to inform you that my visit is not merely social," $heOrShe looks genuinely regretful. "I hate doing this, but I shall make it quick so that we may move on with our lives once this small awkwardness is finished." 

$Rank $personName clears $hisOrHer throat, "You have something my superior wants. I'm sure you know what it is. Hand it over now and I'll give you the $entity.fwt_payment credits my employers have generously set aside for this transaction." 

You realize that $heOrShe is, of course, talking about $entity.fwt_thingDesc.

$HeOrShe releases a breath, "That wasn't so bad, right? And you'll be paid for your trouble. Quite a deal." $HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer console idly, then looks up and adds "I shudder to consider having to kill you."
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_accept:交出 $entity.fwt_theThing 并获取报酬

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest FWBAddStoryOption
Highlight $entity.fwt_payment
text:
The comms-link crackles to life. "Bright stars and steady burns, captain! It's your lucky day," $heOrShe says with a conviction you feel like you can't trust, "You've found something very special that my, ah, superiors have been looking for. They've sent me all the way out here to pay you $entity.fwt_payment credits for handing it over to me for safekeeping."

You realize that $heOrShe is talking about $entity.fwt_thingDesc.

"The cost of fuel these days, why, I'm doing you a favor." $HeOrShe pauses, then says "This is an opportunity that can profit us both. I hope you can see that."
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，并关闭通讯
fwt_accept:接受交易，交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
$faction $personRank 对你竟然接受了$hisOrHer的条件感到非常惊讶。

"嗯，非常好。"$HeOrShe点了点头，"一个出乎意料，但十分明智的决定。"$HeOrShe似乎不确定这时候还该说些什么，于是耸了耸肩并断开了通讯。

你开始考虑接下来该做些什么。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
AddCommodity credits $entity.fwt_payment
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
在$HeOrShe转移款项时，这位 $faction $personRank 看起来十分高兴。

"完美！太棒了。和你做生意十分愉快，$playerName。"你们在敷衍地相互寒暄了几句之后就切断了通讯链接。

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
Highlight $fwt_thingDesc
SetStoryOption fwt_bluffPirate general "对海盗虚张声势来得到 $entity.fwt_thing "
$fwt_piratePayment = 10,000 0
text:
The display flickers with holo-snow before resolving into a swaggering pirate captain.

"Ah look at you there, what a fine $shipOrFleet. A little birdie told me you have $fwt_thingDesc and come next shift I'm going to be the one a-holding $fwt_itOrThem. Do you see my meaning, captain? It'd be a crying shame if anything happened to your fine $shipOrFleet."

$HeOrShe pretends to be pondering deeply, "Now, 'way I see this going, are you gonna make the smart choice and hand $fwt_itOrThem over all peaceful-like, or are you gonna be sucking vacuum after I blow your $shipOrFleet out of orbit? Think, now, think."
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_bluffPirate:对其进行恐吓
fwt_acceptPirates:交出 $fwt_theThing

script:
$player.kantaBluffs++
$player.ethosLiar++
Highlight $fwt_piratePayment
AddCommodity credits $fwt_piratePayment
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
Your stare bores into the pirate like twin tachyon lances as you bellow your words, "You dare claim property of the Warlord Kanta?"

The blood drains from the pirate captain's face. "She... but... by, stars and blood. Captain, please accept my apologies! I would never... she doesn't need to hear of this, isn't that right? Please- please accept a token of $fwt_piratePayment credits for this unfortunate delay."

$HeOrShe is almost pleading now, "So, captain. Captain, you won't mention this little incident?"

The pirate nods grimly, "Yes... yes of course." $HeOrShe studies you, attempting to divine if you'll tell Kanta of $hisOrHer transgression.

And if so, what steps might be taken to change one's name and appearance. Then, perhaps, the wisdom of crewing on a long salvage expedition in the fringe of the Persean Sector far, far away from anyone with the name 'Kanta'.

You take this cue to terminate the comms and roll your eyes at the pirate's cowardice.

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"所以你就这么打算把 $fwt_itOrThem 给我了？"看起来海盗船长对你的举动抱持着怀疑的态度。"我想这样也不错，明智之举，非常划算。"$HeOrShe一边在破旧的数据平板上确认交接的过程，一边在那里嘟囔着。

"那就这样吧，舰长。不用战斗，也没有荣誉可言..."$HeOrShe带着忧郁的眼神望向远方，"我想这是个全新的时代了。一切都是生意，没有任何冒险，那么我们为什么要回到 —— "

通讯被毫无预兆地从另一端切断了。

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
SetStoryOption fwt_bluffPather general "为了留下 $entity.fwt_thing 而开始你的表演"
text:
通讯伴随着大量的噪点和不稳定的闪烁，当 $faction $rank 开始说话时，你意识到这是由于左径旗舰的设备维护不当。

"称颂修道之路指引我来到你身边。你是愿受剑与锤的苦难？还是就此悔过，交出引你走入歧途的 $entity.fwt_theThing？"

"勿认为我疯狂，舰长。"$HeOrShe说。"我每日为异教徒和叛教者祈祷，正如现在，我祈祷着我能于纯净无比的虚空中毁灭 $entity.fwt_TheThing，而非让你的旗舰在升腾于地狱的烈火中陨落。接受我的怜悯吧。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯
fwt_bluffPather:开始一段惊天地泣鬼神的表演
fwt_acceptPather:接受建议，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
你表面上对$hisOrHer的教义信以为真，这令左径分子大感震惊。$HeOrShe这是在为你祈祷吗？当真？

你绘声绘色地向左径分子解释你曾如何误入罪恶的歧途，而如今又多么希望得到拯救。你边说边点着头，表情真挚而略显迷茫。

与此同时，你十指纷飞，向行动长官打出了精确的指令。

Sounding almost in tears, you make a show of repenting, accepting a transmission of Luddic Path holovids - speeches by a Brother Cotton figure prominently in the files.

"It is time," the Pather says, "To take your first step." You nod, then turn and give the order to eject $entity.fwt_theThing so that it may be cleansed in the holy vacuum.

A blip drifts across the tactical display; the Pather blasts it into a spray of exotic particles.

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 5
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"现在，"$HeOrShe合上眼睛吟诵着，"让我们一起祈祷。"

左径舰长念叨着经典的卢德祷文，乞求宽恕，将对神的造物的摧残降到最低限度之类。

你找了个合适的时机终止了通讯。接着，你向你的行动长官表示称赞，称赞对方能从如此简短的说明里领会到你的意图，弄出了一个传感特征与 $entity.fwt_theThing 相似的东西。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 1
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
当你接受$hisOrHer的条件时，$rank庄严地点点头。你下令将 $fwt_theThing 弹射到太空中。接着左径分子把它炸成了一团奇异的粒子。

"现在，"$HeOrShe合上$hisOrHer的眼睛吟诵着，"让我们祈祷。"

左径舰长念叨着经典的卢德祷文，乞求宽恕，将对神的造物的摧残降到最低限度之类。

你在合适的时机里终止了通讯。

通讯频道播放着 速子科技 那悦耳的拨号提示音，接着他们的商标逐渐变淡，一位衣着光鲜的速子科技 $rank 出现在了你的面前。

"我是来给你 $entity.fwt_payment 星币的。"$HeOrShe的脸上挂着无可挑剔的微笑，"被吸引住了吗？别不承认，这是人的天性。"

"当然了，"$HeOrShe举起了一只手，你注意到对方手上昂贵的机械腕表正在散发着奇怪的光效，"你必须给我一些东西作为回报 —— 你手上的 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。这是一场简单而公平的商业交易，没有威胁，没有欺骗，有的只是诚信。把 $fwt_itOrThem 交给我，我就会把星币给你。"
options:
fwt_acceptTT:接受交易
fwt_declineTT:拒绝交易

script:
AddCommodity credits $entity.fwt_payment
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 3
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"完美，舰长。"速子科技的 $rank 确认了货物的转移，并且看起来正因为某种精神层面的力量而感到痛苦。$hisOrHer的手臂被抬了起来，$hisOrHer的脸上放射着快乐的光芒。"真是轻松愉快。接着这个，"一个似乎是某种控制器的植入体闪着微光，"这是给你的报酬。"

"我真诚地祝愿我们下一次做生意的机会能够快点到来，"$HeOrShe说。"明亮的星光和长明的尾焰。务必记得在 TriLink 上添加我！"

你关闭了通讯频道，接着又关掉了数据平板上出现的通知。

"啊。"速子科技 $rank 脸上完美的微笑消失了。你能在$hisOrHer的眼睛里捕捉到某种控制器闪烁的微光，但是你不能确定$HeOrShe在做什么。

"我明白了，"$HeOrShe说。"这是个被错失的机会。我真诚地相信，下次您会看到我的建议的有效性。在那之前，只有明亮的星光和长明的尾焰。"

你开始将手伸向终止通讯的按钮。"我差点忘了，"$HeOrShe快速地说道，" —— 务必在 TriLink 上添加我，这样我就能 —— "

按下按钮终止通讯后又过了一会儿，你关掉了数据平板上弹出的通知。

随着通讯图像的一阵波动，一个雇佣舰长出现在了画面当中。

"祝您空行无阻，跳跃利落，舰长！"$heOrShe带欢快地向你点头致敬。"向您致以星域中最崇高的敬意。接下来我就直说了：我的雇主对您手里的某件东西很感兴趣。而对方雇了我，要求我不惜一切代价从您这楼里拿下。" 雇佣兵耸了耸肩，还带着些问心无愧的感觉，"别惊讶，这不过是个谋生手段罢了。"

你意识到$HeOrShe提到的东西应该是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"我给你一分钟考虑一下。毕竟如果我必须为了那点小事就要把你的旗舰轰成渣的话，那还真是太可惜了。"随后$HeOrShe便靠在了椅子上，并哼着一首不知名的小曲。
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_acceptMerc:接受提议，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
通讯图像波动了一阵子，接着一个雇佣舰长出现在了画面中，还潇洒地把一只脚搭在$hisOrHer的控制台上。

"航线通畅！跳跃顺利！舰长！"$HeOrShe带着愉快的表情向你点头致意。"多么美好的一天！但有个混蛋给了我一堆星币并想让我把它们转交给你。确切地说，$fwt_payment 星币。而你要做的，"$HeOrShe把腿从控制台上拿了下来，俯身靠向全息通信画面，"就是交出那个特别的东西，那个我的雇主们心心念念的东西。"

你意识到$HeOrShe正在说的东西是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"这可是满满的利益，舰长。"$HeOrShe似乎很确信你会为了这些星币而抛弃原先的合同。"我不想用你的旗舰来练习打靶，$playerSirOrMadam。所以让我们用星币来解决吧。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_acceptMerc:接受交易，交出 $entity.fwt_theThing 并获取报酬

text:
通讯显示一开始断断续续的，过了一会才稳定下来，一个雇佣舰长出现在你面前。

"祝您航行平稳！轨道通畅！舰长，"$HeOrShe带着灿烂的笑容向你致意。"让我先澄清一件事：我的合同不允许我使用暴力威胁。所以我不会胁迫您，只能给您提建议。如果您不接受，"$HeOrShe耸耸肩，"好吧，那样我就拿不到奖金了。所以请您务必考虑一下。"

"我来到这里的目的呢，是代我的雇主用 $fwt_payment 星币从您那里买一个东西。我想，"$HeOrShe看起来有些难以启齿，"您应该知道我说的是什么。"你当然知道对方指的是 $entity.fwt_ThingDesc。
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，并关闭通讯
fwt_acceptMerc:接受，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
看起来雇佣兵 $personRank 对你接受$hisOrHer的条件感到有些惊讶。

"真是意外之喜，舰长。这一次你让事情进行的十分顺利。要是每个人都能展现出这样的合作诚意就好了。"有那么一阵子$HeOrShe似乎在脑海中构架出了那样一个美好的世界，然后摇了摇$hisOrHer的头。

"十分感谢，再见。"

通讯链接被断开了，你开始思考接下来该做些什么。

MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger

text:
"那么事情就告一段落了，"雇佣兵 $personRank 说，脸上写着满满的高兴。"没有比这更令人愉快的交易了。也许今后我们还有机会再做做生意？"

$HeOrShe笑了笑，然后切断了通讯链接。

$numSeen++

$numSeen++

id: # GENERIC: fleet will hail player once and fire off a trigger based on a variable

text:
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被接受了。

"你好，舰长，" Coureuse 说，同时为没有转向你道了个歉 —— 她的注意力集中在一堆闪烁的全息数据表上，"对不起，我现在太忙了。你需要什么帮助呢？"
notes: # voice == scientist was a little too rude -dgb

text:
The Excubitor Orbis appears before you.

"Captain $playerName," he says by way of greeting, a stern gaze already fixed on you.

The moment draws longer. He seems determined to make you speak first.

You speak first with some kind of secretary who politely persuades you to wait patiently.

After a short time, the image of the Archcurate Jaspis appears. She makes little effort to look toward comms feed as she putters around her office.

"We are blessed by the day," she says.

The comms take some time to connect, and the transmission is patchy, as if sent through damaged or overloaded relays. Nonetheless, Curate Sacraria Standfast appears. 

"Look who's washed up on troubled shores," she says. "How may a servant of Providence help you this day?"

script:
SetEnabled standfastMakeOffering false
SetTooltip standfastMakeOffering "You do not have 5 units of heavy armaments for a covert shipment."
FireBest StandfastOfferingOptionCheck

SetEnabled standfastMakeOffering true
SetTooltip standfastMakeOffering "Offer 5 units of heavy armaments to the Volturn insurgency."

text:
"The shrine appreciates your devotion," the curate says, "But we must wait some time longer before your next... contribution. A prideful display so soon might be viewed as intemperate by certain higher powers."

"We shall pray on this matter."

"A donation directly to... those in need... would be most welcome." 

In roundabout language, Curate Sacraria Standfast explains that her network could move 5 units of heavy armaments to the surface. There is, however, a small risk of generating suspicion from the Sindrian Diktat authorities.

script:
AddText "The arrangements are made, and Steadfast offers her prayers and well-wishes, promising that your gifts will be put to righteous purpose."
AddRemoveCommodity hand_weapons -5 true
AdjustRep luddic_church 1
AdjustRepActivePerson 2
$offeringMade = true 60
AddTextSmall "Automated traffic monitoring flags suspicious cargo transfer" highlight
FireAll PopulateOptions

text:
The comms take some time to connect, and the transmission is patchy, as if sent through damaged or overloaded relays. Nonetheless, Curate Sacraria Standfast appears. 

"The true believer returns," she says coolly. "Come to explain a new compromise?"
After a short wait, your connection request is denied.

霸主 的标识转了好长一段时间后，一位海军学员模样的人接受了你发起的通讯请求。你怀疑此人甚至还没有从海军学院毕业。

"您好，公民。" 学员用洪亮清脆的语气飞快地叨念了起来，"这里是 霸主 最高领导人的办公室。目前无法预订 霸主 理事会园区的游览行程。如果您想了解更多关于如何恢复人之领荣光的信息，请接受信息数据包上传。"
"不好意思，至高霸主事务繁忙。" 接待你的那名学员温和地微笑着。

script:
$gotHoloExperience = true
$player.gotHegemonyHoloExperience = true
AddTextSmall "获得霸主 150 周年纪念活动全息体验卡带" highlight
FireAll PopulateOptions
text: "我希望你能享受 霸主 历史带来的感官盛宴，" 接待你的学员说，"从 Molina 上将在大崩塌后的混乱中拯救英仙座星域的那次史诗级远航，一直到至高霸主 Daud 战胜 速子科技 和 AI 入侵者。"

在短暂的等待中，你可以看到 霸主 海军的宣传海报在他们的舰队上方滚动着，然后你向 Rao 上将办公室发起的通讯请求被接受了。

"所以，"在 Raesvelg 之围中诞生的英雄看着你，"一个自由佣兵跑到这穷乡僻巷来做什么？"

The comms-link takes a moment to establish. Skiron adjusts the feed parameters as she greets you, clearly unused to holo-comms.

"Captain. Your crew have been most helpful in establishing a colonial comms network. Have you been able to reach Command? We are most anxious to receive new orders, especially given our upgraded capacities."
notes: # no additional options because she's not in contact with Hegemony yet

text:
The comms-link takes a moment to establish. Skiron adjusts the feed parameters as she greets you.

"Greetings captain. All proceeds in accordance with protocol."

options: skiron_askProtocols:"So, ah. Do you still follow 'the Protocols'?"

text:
"Of course; the Protocols are-" She catches herself and looks just a little embarrassed. "I mean to say, we continue to follow the principles, yes. We are receiving updated training to bring the settlement in line with current doctrine, as per the personal request of the High Hegemon."

She sits up just a little straighter, as if Baikal Daud is, perhaps, keeping an eye on her.

"I would like to extend the thanks of myself and our colony for your technical assistance," Commander Skiron beams as she speaks.

"The crew you left with us are ready to return to your $shipOrFleet; my quartermaster shall coordinate transport with your subordinates," she says.

"Well, ah. Most of them will be returning. A few have come to... other accommodations in their time among us, and we honor their contribution to our world."

Your $shipOrFleet approaches $entityName.

The armored asteroid-station bristles with weapons, targeting arrays active and hungry. Small warships flit about like hornets, and the comms channels are flooded with the screech of electronic warfare.

Doing any kind of business here will not be possible until things calm down.
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被拒绝了。
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被拒绝了。

options: kd_OtherPostTalkToKanta:"I want to talk to Kanta."
kd_OtherPostTalkToKanta:"I want to talk to Kanta."

text:
$HeOrShe blinks at you.

"Why're you talking to me, then? Call her yourself," $heOrShe says with a snort.
OR
"Kanta? Ha-ha, I'll just ask if she's free."

$HeOrShe lets that hang for a moment.

"You get hit on the head? You don't just - talk - to the Warlord. Need's you a real good reason. Anyway, not up to me," $heOrShe crosses $hisOrHer arms. "Ask the station king."
OR
"Yeah? That'll have to be too bad 'cause I just do my bit, and if she wants something, someone tells me. Only goes one way."

$HeOrShe leans back, satisfied with that explanation.
OR
"Talk to the station king," $heOrShe says brusquely. "Not for me to say who gets to see the pirate queen."

id:
# Meeting Warlord Kanta, first time. Options:
# 1. comms Station King
# 2. comms Kanta
# 3. or just try to take a shuttle in

text: Your request cycles for a minute, then routes to a different link.
Your request cycles for a minute, then routes to a different link.
The vid feed flickers to life, a wash of static and audio distortion receding as your datapad adjusts for outdated comm protocols.

"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls. "And what makes you think you can show your rotten vis on this line asking for big K? She's ent gonna talk to any mudboot that crawls aboard unless it's to tell 'em about their one-way trip to join the disk, ha-ha."
"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls before bothering to glance at a grimy datapad. "Ah," $hisOrHer demeanor shifts hostility down several levels. "You again. Right, right."

"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls before bothering to glance at a grimy datapad. 

"Ah," $heOrShe grunts, dropping the datapad with a clatter. "I see now. You ent nothing, are you. Got a fleet, have you. Got business to talk?"

"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls before bothering to glance at a grimy datapad.

"Ah," $heOrShe grunts, dropping the datapad with a clatter. "I see now. You ent nothing, are you. Got a colony or two, have you. Got business to talk?"
"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls before bothering to glance at a grimy datapad. $heOrShe grunts, dropping the datapad with a clatter. "You're nothing. Why are you here, wasting my time?"

The portking of Kanta's Den appears before you with all of $hisOrHer singular charm. "You blasted, bloody rad-addled fool! You think you can vac-drop the Warlord's pet then just dance yourself back into her home? Them is some brassies you've got $playerName, but you got 'em instead of brains. I almost respect it."

$HeOrShe spits, the projectile presumably landing on $hisOrHer own control interface, "But only almost. Meantime, I'll be sittin' and smilin' watching all Kanta's underbosses fight for the chance to slag your flagship."
After an exceptionally rude gesture, the comms cut out.

text:
The pilot goes through routine chatter with what passes for traffic control. At the point that control asks for the standard bribe for a good landing slot, you have comms control forwarded to your datapad.

"Yeh, who's this then, shuttle?" control crackles, "Gonna buy me lunch, or do you like waiting?"

options: kantasDen_trafficAlready:"Your boss already gave me the go-ahead. Shall we comms them about the delay?"
kantasDen_trafficBribe:"Let's make it easy, friend. Do you like your fry red or green?"
kantasDen_trafficBullyA:"I'm here to see your boss."
kantasDen_trafficBullyB:"Cut the shakedown. I'm here for Kanta."

text: The pilot goes through routine chatter with what passes for traffic control. A previous bribe means you're recognized and get you a direct comms request to the station king, no waiting.
The pilot goes through routine chatter with what passes for traffic control. A previous bribe means you're recognized and given no more trouble than usual.

The pilot goes through routine chatter with what passes for traffic control, then suddenly pulls away in an evasive maneuver.

"Sorry captain," the pilot's voice crackles through to you. "We, uh, have a problem. And um, incoming comms."

The vid feed flickers to life, a wash of static and audio distortion receding as your datapad adjusts for outdated comm protocols.

The portking of Kanta's Den appears before you with all of $hisOrHer singular charm. "You blasted, bloody rad-addled fool! You think you can vac-drop the Warlord's pet then just dance yourself back into her home? Them is some brassies you've got $playerName, but you got 'em instead of brains. I almost respect it."

$HeOrShe spits, the projectile presumably landing on $hisOrHer own control interface, "But only almost. Meantime, I'll be sittin' and smilin' watching all Kanta's underbosses fight for the chance to slag your flagship."

script:
MakeNearbyFleetsHostile pirates 100000 30 true 
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
FireAll PopulateOptions
ShowDefaultVisual
text:
The comms cut. As your shuttle makes a hasty return to your $shipOrFleet, your tactical officer sends an urgent signal.

"Captain. Looks like Kanta's Den sent out a broadcast alert; calling in all nearby pirate fleets to our $shipOrFleet drive signature. Advise prep for hostiles."
"Uhhh, confirm that, shuttle. Negative to request," traffic control says, "Incoming shuttle cleared for, uh, landing at bay 12. Proceed."

You transfer a fractional credit over to the thug running traffic control, enough to cover a generous meal or a round of cheap drinks.

"Eh, here's one to brighten today," control says enthusiastically, "Me, I like going halfsies with the fry, bit-a each. Shuttle, you're cleared to land at munitions bay 12."
options: kantasDen_trafficBullyB:"Let someone important know that I'm here to see Warlord Kanta."

text: "Uhh," says control, "You mean the portboss? Or, er, station king? Or you mean t-the..."
"Um, copy that shuttle," the comms crackle, "Uh, hold. Um, please."

id: # talk to Station King about what PC wants; may or may not already be on a shuttle.

options: 20:devkdSK_sendToken:DEV Send the digital token given to you by Gargoyle
20:devkdKP_askAudience:DEV "I want to arrange an audience with Warlord Kanta. It concerns my colonies."
kdSK_sendToken:Send the digital token given to you by Gargoyle
kdKP_askAudience:"I want to arrange an audience with Warlord Kanta. It concerns my colonies."
kdSK_sparA:"Would it help if I said 'please'?"
kdSK_sparB:"I'm not a desk pilot trying to look big on comms, I'll tell you that much."

text:
"Here's some truth to chew on: you're not talkin' to Kanta. Only family gets in. Or maybe if you're lord-and-master of your own corner of this dead Domain doing real high-credits business. Maybe."

"Understand?"
"No," $heOrShe spits, presumably on $hisOrHer own control console, "Last thing I need is some heggie bootlicking narc dropping ground-dirt in my fine station."
"Oh, got some lip on you have ya?" $HeOrShe spits, presumably on $hisOrHer own control console. "Watch yourself, bootlicker. I could have you stripped down for parts before the shift is out."

You hit the send command and the token is transmitted. Instantly you see the pirate's face change expression.

"Oh. Family, huh? Didn't recognize your face, cap. You don't got the family look; but ha-ha, the Kantas' they are everywhere 'eh? Ludd's hells, you should have said something before I go off broadsiding you."

"You know the drill. The warlord doesn't like comms, so we'll have to make you an appointment with the court. Get your boots on-station and I'll have someone meet you."

options:
kantasDen_visit1:Take a shuttle to Kanta's Den
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Yeah, who're you?" $personName snarls before bothering to glance at a grimy datapad. 

"Ah," $hisOrHer demeanor shifts hostility down several levels. "You again. Right, right."
"Yeah, yeah. That'll be $kpBribeAmount credits," $heOrShe says. "For, ah, administrative expenses."

text:

"You already paid up. It's all arranged. Though uh, if you don't remember... you wanna pay again?
"Yeah, uh. I am once again asking for $kpBribeAmount credits for..." $heOrShe thinks for a moment. "Administrative expenses. Yeah, that was it."

text:
Kanta's Station King grins as the transfer comes through.

"Anyone gives you trouble? Tell 'em I said you're seeing the Warlord 'cause I said so."

$HeOrShe gives you a nod that's probably meant to be equal parts intimidating and reassuring.

id: # null case: not allowed to meet Kanta

text:
You leave four guards and the pilot with your shuttle. Two more guards follow you. A pirate enforcer gives you an unpleasant look and steps directly into your path.

Surprisingly, they begin with what sounds like an attempt at a conciliatory tone, "Look friend, Kanta won't be seeing you this time. The warlord only speaks when there's real big business to talk. If you're not family or lord an' master of your own planet, might as well give up." 

They smile crookedly, "Give the bars a visit, get destroyed, have some fun. Market's open, or the docks."
options:
kd_landingDeniedMust:"I really must speak with Kanta."
kd_landingDeniedStopMe:"Are you going to stop me?"
kd_landingDeniedOtherOptions:See what else can be bought on Kanta's Den

text:
You leave four guards and the pilot with your shuttle. Two more guards follow you. A pirate enforcer gives you an unpleasant look and steps directly into your path.

They begin in a surprisingly conciliatory tone, "Look friend, Kanta won't be seeing you this time. The warlord only speaks when there's real big business to talk. If you're not family or lord an' master of your own planet, might as well give up." 

"Give the bars a visit, get destroyed, have some fun. Market's open, or the docks. I won't even make trouble about your transponder being on." They smile crookedly.
They put on a regretful look. "Like I said, it's only happening if you're family or overlord of your own little corner of the corpse of the Sector. Them's the rules."

"Naw, friend." They glance over a shoulder at a squad of heavily armed ruffians lounging around an enormous armored door inscribed with a skull motif.

"But they will."
You step away and take in the concourse as if you never meant to talk to Kanta anyway. The pirate makes no comment.

You leave four guards and the pilot at your shuttle. Two more guards follow you, and the lanky pirate lieutenant sent to meet you nods that this is correct.

You're led through a primary access corridor toward the center of the station. You adjust quickly to disjointed agrav fields, an effect you suspect is intentional as ranks of pirates of all shapes and ages eye you for weakness, murmuring crude comments and jostling for prestige.

You leave four guards and the pilot at your shuttle. Two more guards follow you, and the pirate lieutenant sent to meet you nods that this is correct.

You're led through a primary access corridor toward the center of the station. You adjust quickly to disjointed agrav fields, an effect you suspect is intentional as ranks of pirates of all shapes and ages eye you for weakness, murmuring crude comments and jostling for prestige.

You can almost pick out a pattern of relations in their faces - this is a family business - and in their anarchic uniforms. They're bedecked in prizes, modified combat armor plated with gold and gems, stolen high-end vacsuits redone in off-brand colors, Tri-Tachyon neck-scarves crudely knotted; ostentatious luxury wear. They wear their wealth on the outside, the more garish the better.

Past pitted blast doors hung with crimson skull-banners, a large bay opens. The lingering acrid scent of energy weapon discharge hangs in the air, almost but not quite concealing the odor of rotting meat.

You're brought before what can only be described as a throne, tastelessly backlit in blood-red for maximum effect. The caps, badges, and insignia of various naval officers are impaled on fused blossoms of trophy weapons. You recognize kit from all of the polities of the Persean Sector.

Above all is the hissing, thrumming figure of Warlord Jorien Kanta, more machine now than human. Her face is a mask. What skin you can see is leathery like the rad scarring of old spacers.

A synthesized voice booms from the throne, "Submit before Kanta!"

script:
ShowSecondPerson cydonia
$player.metCydonia = true
SetPersonHidden cydonia false
text:
Before her a strange, small man hunches. He wears some parody of a doctor's surgical garb.

"You had best kneel," the doctor hisses.

If a broken atmo scrubber could laugh, it might sound like the noise that comes from Kanta. 

"A kneeler!" she shouts. Her guards remain relaxed. "We see you know who is strong here. Know your place. Kanta will watch over you."

The doctor grimaces bloodlessly.

If a broken atmo scrubber could laugh, it might sound like the noise that comes from Kanta. 

"A stander!" she shouts. You note that her guards remain relaxed. "We like you. A heggie would kneel in the mud because all they know is following and groveling. You stand like a spacer."

Her head tracks you. "Kanta will hear you."
The small doctor steps forward and clears his throat, and says "I am Doctor Cydonia, personal assistant to the warlord."

Two guards accompany you onto the station while the rest wait with the shuttle. This is how it is done here.

You're led by one of Kanta's lieutenants toward the center of the station, adjusting to the disjointed agrav fields. Pirates of all shapes and ages eye you for weakness; they're bedecked in prizes, modified combat armor plated with gold and gems, stolen high-end vacsuits, knotted neck-scarves, ostentatious luxury wear.

They wear their spoils, the more garish the better.

script:
BeginConversation kanta false true
ShowSecondPerson cydonia
text:
Past pitted blast doors hung with crimson skull-banners, a large bay opens. The lingering acrid scent of energy weapon discharge hangs in the air, almost but not quite concealing the odor of rotting meat.

You're brought before Kanta's throne, tastelessly backlit in blood-red. The caps, badges, and insignia of various naval officers are impaled on fused blossoms of trophy weapons. Above all is the hissing, thrumming figure of Warlord Jorien Kanta, more machine now than human. Her face is a mask. What skin you can see is space-cured leather.

The maybe-doctor, Cydonia, lurks near the base of her throne. He steps forward, "Behold!" he shrieks, "The court of Warlord Kanta, queen by blood-conquest, is in session!"

id: # now we route to whatever PC was doing next

text:
Cydonia nods stiff-necked, the tiniest hint of a bow, then addresses you before the entire court: "You bear a token of Kanta's kin, Nashyan, who is of the outer family! But Nashyan never gave you this token- I checked."

Now the guards react, leveling their weapons. Not training them on you yet.

notes: # routes over to KP / Kanta's Protection

text:
"我还没有收到霸主最高领导人 Daud 的消息。我认为你应该继续按照我们之前的协议，用我提供的材料来进行联系。"

他用一种看起来很无情的态度打量了你一番，说道："我会很有耐心地在这等着的。"

options: yaribay_followup1:"和我们共同的朋友联系上了吗？"

text:
"我很高兴，我已经和我们共同的朋友取得了联系。" Horus 眨了眨眼，"如同所有美妙的事，享受这种通过努力取得的成果需要时间。"

"看来信任你是个正确的决定。也许我们以后还会进行一些交易。啊，我之前有没有提到，尽管道德层面或许有些污点，Yaribay 这个姓氏却在最新一代人身上证明着它的学术实力？好吧，让我告诉你..."

在被 Yaribay 后裔于 Galatia 学院取得的各种如传说般的成就塞满耳朵之前，你设法成功溜之大吉。
"不幸的是，我还没有收到来自...我们共同的朋友的消息。" Horus 皱着眉头说，"也许这只是时间问题。就像对所有美好的事物一样，我们必须得满怀期待。"

你看着在 速子科技 公司大楼徽标附近划过的挥发物期货广告，度过了一段漫长的等待时光。最后，一位从属于 CEO Artemisia Sun 办公室且梳妆打扮十分完美的初级秘书接受了你的通讯请求。

"速子科技公司欢迎您来到 Eochu Bres。请问我们能帮您什么忙吗？"

没有哪个活人能做到如此勾人兴致的程度，你意识到了这是某种 AI 全息模拟界面的影像。
options:
sunOffice_talk:"我想和 Artemisia Sun 谈谈。"
sunOffice_human:"请让真人接听通讯。"
cutCommLink:切断通讯

text:
"对不起，舰长，"模拟秘书脸上荡漾出一个耀眼的微笑，情绪酝酿得恰好能传递出歉意并让你产生一丝自我怀疑 —— 不，你坚定了内心。模拟程序不可能有感情。

"恐怕我无法完成您的请求。"从它友好语气的深处，你能感受到无情的机械意志。哪怕你在这里乞求几天，对方也不会做出一丝一毫的让步。

"对不起，舰长，"模拟秘书脸上荡漾出一个耀眼的微笑，情绪酝酿得恰好能传递出歉意并让你产生一丝自我怀疑 —— 不，你坚定了内心。模拟程序不可能有感情。

"恐怕我无法完成您的请求。"从它友好语气的深处，你能感受到无情的机械意志。哪怕你在这里乞求几天，对方也不会做出一丝一毫的让步。

After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

Lamech looks impatiently up from a datapad covered in columns of numbers, "Yes? Is it important?"
OR
After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

A holo visualization of some kind of protein structure spins in front of Lamech. "What is it?" he says impatiently.
OR
After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

"I'm very busy," Lamech says through a filtration mask. He seems to be wearing globes and holding some kind of glassware in his hands. "You'll have to make it quick."

id: # Tri-Tachyon contact; peace sells, but who's buying?

options: 10:ttContact_bribeRep:"I need to fix my reputation with the Tri-Tachyon Corporation."
10:ttContact_bribeRep:"I need to fix my reputation with the Tri-Tachyon Corporation."

script:
SetEnabled ttContact_bribeRep false
SetTooltip ttContact_bribeRep "Only available if relations with Tri-Tachyon are hostile or worse."

conditions:
$option == ttContact_bribeRep
Commission hasOtherCommission
Commission commissionFactionIsAtWarWith tritachyon
text:
$HeOrShe gives you a skeptical look, then speaks. "Here's the problem, champ. You've got a commission with $theOtherCommissionFaction. And they're at war with the Tri-Tachyon Corporation."

"You want to get out of fighting and back to doing business?" $HeOrShe spreads $hisOrHer hands. "Resign the commission, that's my advice."

"And by the way, talking to you isn't going to do wonders for my reputation in the Company, so I hope your encryption is good."

$HeOrShe doesn't quite snort dismissively, but it's close.

"You're in quite a hole. Tri-Tachyon will want compensation for damages. And while the Company isn't sentimental, you've offended a lot of people."

$HeOrShe considers this for a moment, "They will have to be paid off. Credits soothe most wounds... if you have enough credits."
"I can probably do it for 500,000 credits. No one is going to be your friend, but this gets your foot in the door so you can patch things up."

$HeOrShe nods. You can see $heOrShe has that grim look one gets when they have to make a lot of uncomfortable comms calls.

"Now I've got work to do, starting with comming some local contacts. Be on your best behavior, $playerName, and we can make this work."
"You've been difficult before, $playerName," $heOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head. "It can't be done for less than 1,000,000 credits."
options:
ttContact_bribeRep1mAccept:"One million, let's do it."
ttContact_bribeRepDecline:Decline

text:
$HeOrShe nods. You can see $heOrShe has that grim look one gets when they have to make a lot of uncomfortable comms calls.

"I've got a lot of work to do, and a lot of credits to throw around, starting with some local contacts. Be on your very best behavior, $playerName. I don't want to do this again."

"I don't know why I still talk to you," $heOrShe muses. "You've made a very expensive enemy in Tri-Tachyon again and again. And now you return, begging forgiveness? It will take a fortune in bribes. You understand this, don't you?"

$HeOrShe sighs deeply, leaning back and, rubbing $hisOrHer face with $hisOrHer hands. Finally, $heOrShe gets back up to face the holo-feed.

"10,000,000 credits. Count those zeroes carefully, captain."
options:
ttContact_bribeRep10mAccept:"Make it happen. Transferring now."
ttContact_bribeRep10mOutrageous:"That seems outrageously expensive."
ttContact_bribeRepDecline:Decline

text:
"Does it? Good!" $heOrShe says spitefully.

"You've been an outrage! It's going to be very expensive! Deal with the consequences!"

"So," $heOrShe looks grim. "We're really doing this." $HeOrShe looks away, up at nothing. 

"You should have bought a planet to go live on for the rest of your life. It'd probably be cheaper. And I wouldn't have to pull some strings that I'd rather avoid."

$HisOrHer gaze returns to the holo-feed. "But here we are. Now I'm going to go spend a fortune to make people tolerate you. Don't screw it up."

The comm-link terminates.

"No," $heOrShe says abruptly. "I've put myself out there for you... too much. The credits are good, but... I can't believe I'm saying this," $heOrShe closes $hisOrHer eyes.

"Credits are not enough," $heOrShe admits, then locks you with a fierce look.

"You've made a complete meltdown of... everything! Again and again! You're absolutely radioactive! I'm not doing it, I'm not sticking my neck out for you. No number of credits can change my mind. This discussion is over."

$PersonName terminates the comm-link.
"I'm simply presenting you with an option," $heOrShe says, all business. "Let me know if you reconsider."

对方皱着眉头打量着你，似乎在评估着什么。

"你好，我是 Ibrahim 星际运输与打捞公司的 Callisto Ibrahim。"

The link waits, drops connection, then re-tries. The comms don't seem to be working correctly.

Or Ibrahim has keyed your id to an auto-disconnect.

script:
BeginConversation sec_officer true true
FireAll AndradaOfficeReplies
text:
在观看辛达强权宣传片中度过了漫长的等待时光后，通讯链接里出现了一位表情严肃的下级军官，他还穿着狮心卫队的制服，那是 Andrada 个人所属的思想纪律严明的军事组织。

"胜利属于辛达瑞亚之狮！"$heOrShe和你对话时带着惊人的热情，"你打算如何为最高行政官的愿景服务？"

这样的要求让你觉得有些为难。

options: andradaOffice_speak2:"我想向光荣的最高行政官 Andrada 将军请愿。"
andradaOffice_serve:"你不是该问问我有什么需要帮助的吗？"
andradaOffice_serve2:"我不知道。你来告诉我如何为狮王的愿景效力吧。"

text:
$Rank $PersonName's face tightens a little, somehow.

"You do not simply speak with," $heOrShe takes on a corrective tone, "the Supreme Executor, the Lion of Sindria, Admiral Philip Andrada."

A pause for breath, then $heOrShe continues, "And I would warn you to show proper deference to the greatness of the man."

$PersonName $Rank 稍微点了点头。

"你肯定已经知道，辛达瑞亚之狮收到过无数来自他忠实追随者的请愿书，我将记录你的请求。"

You notice a small eye-twitch.

"The office of the Supreme Executor does not provide handouts. It is the strong who find themselves drawn to the glorious vision of Supreme Executor Admiral Philip Andrada, and who, through his Movement, shall return civilization to the Persean Sector and then the former Domain." 

$HeOrShe looks up, you presume at a portrait of Andrada. "It is only, ONLY through service to his unique and glorious vision for a new humanity that excellence may be achieved."

$HisOrHer gaze lowers toward you, now. "The only question you must answer is: how do you fit into that vision?" $HisOrHer eyes narrow, "Or will you find yourself among the dregs of history?"

script:
AddTextSmall "收到 \"最高行政官语录\"" highlight
$player.gotAndradaBook = true
text:
$PersonName $Rank 尽职地点着头，一些类似但又不同于愉悦的东西在$hisOrHer的脸上闪过。

"服从于最高行政官 Phillip Andrada 将军对光辉未来的伟大愿景是第一步。让我先发给你几篇宣传材料..."

"这将是你的起点，从辛达瑞亚之狮的沉思中总结出的智慧结晶。辛达强权的公民，光荣愿景的追随者，发现这些话可以在日常生活的各个方面提升他们。"

$HeOrShe俯下身来，"就我个人而言，我喜欢在睡前和醒来时读几行。我发现能让我更专注，使我的意志与运动的必要性一致。"

$heOrShe靠了回去，继续说，"为辛达强权的利益服务。你可能会很幸运地发现自己在我们的事业中有一席之地 —— 去找管理员，他们可以帮你接受服务于最高行政官的雇佣。"
options:
andradaOffice_book2:"呃，谢谢。"
andradaOffice_book1:"我会研读它的，夜以继日。"

text: "很好。" $heOrShe坚定地点了点头。
"你迟早会感谢我的。" $heOrShe说，话语中没有讽刺的味道。

"为辛达强权的利益服务，"$heOrShe毫不犹豫地说。

"顺从我们的光荣愿景，你自然就身处为辛达强权服务的行列中。和管理员谈谈，他们会和你商谈雇佣事宜。"

Deputy Star Marshal Hyder appears, her face impassive. "Contact identified, maintain course," she speaks to another bridge officer before turning to comms.

"Independent fleet, hear me: stay clear of our operational volume and you will not be fired upon."

"Hyder out."

The comms snap off before you have a chance to speak.

Deputy Star Marshal Hyder appears, her face impassive. "Independent fleet," she says, not acknowledging your previous contact, "Hear me: stay clear of our operational volume and you will not be fired upon."

"Hyder out."

The comms snap off before you have a chance to speak.

Deputy Star Marshal Hyder appears. "Captain," she says, impassive but respectful. "Please stay clear of our operational volume." 

And pause, then "We have nothing further to discuss at this time. Hyder out."

The comms snap off before you have a chance to speak.

Guard High Deputy Executor Caden appears; he barely looks at the comms.

"Independent fleet: maintain distance and you will not be fired upon. Hear and obey," Caden declares.

"Final victory to the Supreme Executor!" Caden shouts with genuine enthusiasm before snapping the comms off.

Guard High Deputy Executor Caden doesn't even bother to open to comms; instead, a blank-faced Sindrian Diktat officer appears, and speaks.

"Minor independent fleet: maintain distance and you will not be fired upon. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" 

And with that, they snap off the comms-line.

The image of Guard High Deputy Executor Caden appears. He is not even looking at the comms-feed.

"Independent fleet: maintain distance and you will not be fired upon. Hear and obey," Caden declares, taking a breath.

"Final victory to the Supreme Executor!" he shouts, and the comms snap off without waiting for a reply.

Guard High Deputy Executor Caden doesn't even bother to open the comms; instead, a blank-faced Sindrian Diktat officer appears.

"Minor independent fleet: maintain distance and you will not be fired upon. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" 

Without waiting for a reply, the connection is terminated.

Guard High Deputy Executor Caden appears before you. "Glory to the Sindrian Diktat, captain!" he booms enthusiastically. "It stirs the heart to see another proud follower of the Supreme Executor's vision upholding the Great Cause." 

He blinks, perhaps realizing that he doesn't actually have anything to say to you. "Stay strong and stay vigilant - as Supreme Executor Andrada taught us. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" 

Without waiting for a reply, the connection is terminated.

Guard High Deputy Executor Caden appears before you. "Ah, Captain $playerName. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" he booms enthusiastically. "It stirs the heart to see a loyal follower of the Supreme Executor's vision, and," he leans in, "One who will stand with me when the time comes, when strength and loyalty will be required to secure the future of the Persean Sector."

He leans back, satisfied. "Stay strong and vigilant - as Supreme Executor Andrada taught us. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" 

Without waiting for a reply, the connection is terminated.

Dolos Macario, the Spider of Sindria, appears before you. He looks bored.

"Captain, o captain," he greets you, his tone bored. "Not yet." He winks and hits the shut-off.

The crest of the Sindrian Diktat internal security ministry slowly turns.

text: As you start to take in the clientele, the lights flicker. The sundry holos and screens fuzz and go blank as EM interference scrambles their inputs.

With a series of bangs, troopers in light combat frames burst through every entrance, shouting amplified orders, waving vicious little guns. 

Random INTSEC raid; you know enough to appear calm and keep your hands away from your sidearm.

Each patron is scanned and, in-turn, their fate is revealed by a subtle movement of the lead INTSEC officer signaling whether they are to be left alone or arrested. Most are spared.

One group of spacers appears to believe they have something to hide. As the officer approaches, they break into action. One manages to half-draw a concealed weapon but is hit with the crack of an electrostun/restraint-foam round. The convulsing body crashes through a table, sending pieces of broken glass up in glittering parabolae.

The rest of the party are restrained and beaten, the drumming of clubs on flesh eventually overtaking the cries of pain and outrage. Outsiders look on in horror; the staff and locals have a glazed, unfocused expression; it is safest to see nothing.

The Diktat Internal Security officer walks slowly on a tangent to you, examining each of your bodyguards from their feet to their weapons before shifting his gaze to you. You stare for a moment into dark eyes.
options:
sdbr_sayNothing:Say nothing
sdbr_sayBarbaric:"This is barbaric."
sdbr_sayThankYou:"Thank you for your service, sir."
sdbr_saySarcastic:"Thank you for your service, sir." (sarcastic)

text: His eyes narrow and flick down to his scanner.
He says nothing, just stares at you for a moment as if a chair tried to start a conversation.
He responds with the automatic phrase, "The Movement is its own reward," if not with warmth, then at least the comfort that his internal IFF has slotted you into a non-hostile category.
He says nothing, just stares at you for a moment. His off-hand twitches significantly and your world explodes with light and pain.
options: sdbr_beating1:Close your eyes and cover your vitals

text: He says nothing, just stares at you for a moment. His off-hand twitches significantly and your world explodes with light and pain.
options: sdbr_beating1:Close your eyes and cover your vitals

script:
ShowImageVisual volturn
AdjustRep sindrian_diktat SUSPICIOUS -3
$player.wasBeatenBySD = true
text:
You find yourself slumped against a rattling air vent in a minor offshoot of the commercial concourse. One of your guards, bleeding and appallingly bruised, applies a dermal patch to your neck and your consciousness acknowledges the ocean of pain receding like a tide, leaving a loose hollowness in your chest and numbing cold in your limbs.

INTSEC simply wanted to send a message, it appears. Nothing more, nothing less.
options:
sdbr_beatingTreatment:Just get back to your ship
sdbr_beatingRevenge:Swear that you will have revenge
sdbr_beatingHadItComing:Admit that you had it coming

text:
It would almost be more reassuring to feel the pain. Without it, you feel empty. And tired.

With the help of your guards, you slowly make your way back to your ship.

You focus on the INTSEC officer's face, using your physical pain to sear it into your memory. 

One day, you swear, he will receive justice.
You reflect that this is simply how power works. When challenged, it must prove itself or the illusion evaporates.

The INTSEC officer gives a small nod to the guards, then moves on with arbitrary authority to the next spacer captain, who is given a similar treatment.

Apparently this means you're free to go. There will be no more business to be done at this bar for the rest of the shift. Even the corridors outside are strangely quiet, the populace recognizing the tell of a crackdown.
Your comms officer calls for your attention, "Captain, we have incoming from... um, an official channel. No ID provided." They forward the link to your personal interface.
Your comms officer calls for your attention, "Captain, we have incoming from... um, an official channel. No ID provided." They forward the link to your personal interface.
A Sindrian Diktat officer appears. You first recognize the uniform of the internal security ministry; the secret police. Then you recognize his face.

You were at a spacer bar, not too long ago. This officer led a raid, and his security troops beat some jumpy spacers near to death, and arrested others.

What game is he playing by contacting you like this? Does he even remember you?

He must.

You were at a spacer bar, not too long ago. This officer led a raid, and his security troops beat some jumpy spacers near to death, and arrested others. You told him what you thought of his actions, and for that he had you beaten.
And you swore that revenge would be yours. Now might be your chance, if you play this right. But what's his game here, why is he approaching you?

And you understood that he was simply exercising the power he had, as he must from his position. Now he's back. What game is he playing? Does he even remember you?

He must.

You returned to your ship where some fine med-tech did its work. Now he's back. What game is he playing? Does he even remember you?

He must.

"Greetings Captain $playerName," says $Rank Ram with detached authority. "I've been following your career for some time. You are, mm, quite ideally placed."

"I need you to help me save the Sindrian Diktat." He produces a painful-looking smile at this, and looks like he expects you to return it.

options: sdtu_ramRespCommission:"As bearer of a Sindrian Diktat commission, it is my duty to help."
sdtu_ramRespWhatWant:"What could you possibly want from me?"
sdtu_ramRespRemember:"Do you remember me? I remember you."
sdtu_ramRespThugsBeat:"You had your thugs beat me. Now you want my help?"
sdtu_ramRespHateSD:"I hate the Sindrian Diktat. I don't want to save it."
sdtu_ramRespAllIn:"I'm in. Where do we start?"

text:
"Yes, yes," Ram leans in, an odd gleam to his eyes now apparent. 

"You see clearly that Philip Andrada's vision has been corrupted from the glorious early days. The ministries have fallen to infighting and corruption; our fleets are bloated with incompetents, our factories run by degenerate plunderers. The martial virtues which defined our once-glorious Diktat have been lost - we must reclaim them."

"The Supreme Executor is not himself, and may already be dead. We see holos, but who can say if they are true? Corrupt advisors are exploiting the situation for their own benefit, so it is up to us - the front-line officers loyal to the Movement, who know blood and sweat - to save the Diktat!"

"The Sindrian Diktat has strayed from its course," says Ram, leaning in, an odd gleam to his eyes now apparent. 

"The Supreme Executor is no longer at the helm of the ship of state; holos appear with his image, yes, but they can be faked. It is obvious that the ministries have fallen to in-fighting and self-serving corruption, our warfleets given to profit-driven bloat."

"Without the true vision of the Supreme Executor, the center cannot hold. Corrupt advisors rule now, and are influenced by shadowy forces funded by our enemies. Something must be done!"

"I knew who you were before entering that bar, yes," Ram says with a self-satisfied smirk. 

"I am not merely a uniform. I follow orders, yes, but I have been watching the way of things for a long time. I have been speaking with like-minded officers loyal to the Andradan Movement, who know the blood and sweat of our struggle."

Ram leans in, an odd gleam to his eyes now apparent. "It is obvious that the Sindrian Diktat has fallen to rot. Do you imagine Andrada is truly in command? With the ministries fallen to self-serving infighting? He would never allow it. Things have changed since the old days. He would sooner die than let his vision come to this... this degeneracy! Something must be done!"

"You survived," Ram says, with the barest hint of ruthless delight. "You are a survivor, yes? Stronger now for overcoming. In the words of the Supreme Executor, 'Pain's gift is clarity.'"

"You see, I was merely acting my part in the grand tower of authority necessary to maintain order. If it were not me in the uniform that day, it would have been another." Ram leans in, an odd gleam to his eyes now apparent. "Don't you see? It is bigger than me or you. Hold your animal instinct in check, and listen."

"The Sindrian Diktat is drifting, leaderless. Do you imagine Andrada is really in command? With the ministries fallen to infighting and self-serving corruption? He would never allow it. He would sooner die than let his vision come to this! Something must be done!"

"Precisely," Ram leans in, an odd gleam to his eyes now apparent.

"It has become a hateful thing, hasn't it? It is nothing like the early days, when strong men pure of spirit knew what needed to be done. The course of state has strayed! It is obvious that Supreme Executor Andrada is no longer at the helm, that he no longer truly leads us. It is tragic, isn't it? A great man reduced to this by declining health and bad advisors. It is obvious but unsaid that the ministries have fallen to in-fighting and self-serving corruption."

"The great tower of authority, that great man which once gave order to the world... it is all crumbling. Something must be done!"

He takes a deep breath with closed eyes, then looks on you with renewed vigor. "And you. You are an outsider, you are the perfect wedge for my plan to alter the course of history."

He holds a hand up to stop your reply.

"No, not yet. We must speak in the flesh," he taps something, and your comm-link receives coordinates- an address on Volturn. "There is a safehouse under my personal authority. OpSec will be assured."

$Rank Ram gives a quick nod and signs off.

He wants to set up some kind of secret meeting. It could not be a more perfect opportunity for revenge. 

Your mind races with possibilities- a hidden weapon to cover the kinetic element, a secret holorec rig to record whatever treason or blackmail or scheme he has planned. It would not be so difficult to have a small squad of your most elite marines ready to move at an invisible signal.

He wants to set up some kind of secret meeting. It is unclear whether his actions are legal within the Diktat, and unclear what power-play between competing ministries this might represent.

You would do well to have a hidden weapon, and a holorec rig to record whatever treason, blackmail, or other scheme Ram might be planning. It would not even be difficult to have a squad of elite marines ready to move at an invisible signal.

script:
$global.sdtu_ramDidProposal = true

ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
